number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												*SPOILER ALERT*So first of all let's get this out of the way, I think it's way better than the more linear SE V2, but I think It's not as fun as the first. Let's start:-Graphics: They are alot better than V2, textures are better and more crisp and what I like the most is that the color pallete is much richer than the grays and blacks of V2. There are yellows, blues, reds, greens and etc. To sum it up much better than V2-Enviroment: SE3 is set in Africa, where the grass is green and the Jerries are pretty. No but seriously as I said in the graphics section, Rebellion made the game alot better looking. I really liked the fifth mission's beggining stage where you crawl through a field/oasis and then you approach a big desert town. I found that a very good contrast.-Map design: This is where the last game flopped, V2 was very linear and only one path to go through, this game has alot more open levels with several paths to go through but the general path is the same. To sum it up better than V2 but could be more open.-Gameplay: Preety much the same as V2 but now stealth is possible. You can go through an entire level and not alert anyone. Sniping is as great as it was in the last game, it feels superb.-Sound: I can't comment on this because I dont pay much attention to the background sound, but the guns sound excelent.-Campaign: A lacking plot in which you - Karl Fairburne seem to dismantle the entire Afrika Korps and the Royal Italian Army stationed in Africa in search of a Nazi prototype tank wonder-weapon called the Ratte P1000. The voice acting is honestly comedic and bad, so in summary ignore the plot. The one in V2 was better. Which brings me to the missions. They are long but there are only 8 of them. The campaign will take you about 16 hours, and also not very replayable unless you are going for the collectibles.-Multiplayer: After the campaign you can play the much improved multiplayer. Unlike V2 where it was very campy and it was essencially a free-for-all, here spotting is more encouraged and when you are on a killstreak you are encouraged to relocate to get extra points per kill. The ranking system is cumulative through campaign and multiplayer so you can rank up faster in multiplayer after you finish the campaign. However I miss "Bombing Run" :(-Co-op: You can play through the campaign with a buddy, and also you can play the great Overwatch mode in which one guy is a operative on the ground and another one is the sniper. It is incredibly engrosing and extremely fun.So that sums up Sniper Elite 3, much improved over Sniper Elite V2 but the plot could be alot better. Overall not worth 40 euros, so buy it on a sale and after that enjoy. I rate it 8.5 out of 10

content:
Posted: February 19
												Nvidia gpu owners, beware!This game COULD be great, I mean, the gameplay is fun, but there's no point on me even starting to talk about that because of the state of this game at the moment.Basically, the game crashes every few minutes playing it. I was trying to finish it so that I could buy SE 4, because it looked like a good game, but it was the most frustrating experience I've ever had with a video game in my entire 30 years of life. Having to save every single time you do anything relevant, doing everything all over again if you forget to do that, rushing the game instead of enjoying it because you need to go as fast as you can to experience the least amount of crashes possible and so on...From what info I've gathered, it could be the OS, but most likely it's updating Nvidia drivers that causa the issues.So, the great solution someone found was to downgrade your gpu drivers... just to play this one game. Why? Because Rebellion has just been sitting silent doing absolutely NOTHING to fix the issue, and i'ts likely that they won't, given their usual response to anything is to remain silent and do nothing.This is outrageous. The game is not even 3 years old, so there's no excuse for not even trying to fix it. I mean, they haven't even talked with their playerbase about doing something about it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 12
												A very fun WW2 shooter set in africa. Great mechanics give it a fun mix of stealth with sniper mechanics loosely based on the real world such as bullet drop and using other loud noises like thunder or artillery fire to mask your shots. The game also uses a variety of other weapons such as various sidearms, machine pistols (the MP40 for example) and several grenades and traps that can be used. It also uses a cover system and allows you to distract enemies by throwing objects and both sound and vision (line of sight and light levels) are important.It's a surprisingly in-depth game with a decent amount of levels and a fair amount of replayability with several difficulties and a number of collectibles in each level. If you're a fan of any stealth or sniper gameplay, you'll probably enjoy this game a lot.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
												Short and dissapointing.That basically says it all. A 7 hour campaign. Enemy AI made in 1985, one shot and the entire map knows exactly where you are. Mandatory rpg-unlock system that is just not worth the unlocks. Only 4 rifles in-game, the rest behind a DLC pay-wall. Stealth/relocation mechanic that sucks the fun out of sniping. A story that makes Twilight look like a great love drama. Unlikable main characters. No memorable supporting cast. Anti-climactic ending if there ever was one. It is all kinds of bad rolled into one, and it takes itself way too serious. Playing co-op makes the game even worse for some reason (how is that even possible?)I absolutely love the Zombie Army games, I really like Sniper V2, but this? Even at 70% off I feel cheated.Maybe get it for the multiplayer if that is your cup of tea. Avoid otherwise.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												*This may seem quite negative, but playing multiplayer changed the review into a recommendation... barely.Lets get down to it.For the price asked, is this game worth it? Lets go back a step and ask a more important question; Is this a game?Well, a game is something you have fun interacting with. It challenges you and provides entertainment. Sniper Elite 3 is definitely challenging and it can be fun, so lets pencil in a "yes" for the question of is this a game. Now, is it worth the price?No. Definitely not (Unless you want to go purely multiplayer - see below). I'll admit I have not played the previous 2 iterations of Sniper Elite, but they cannot have been worse than this. The graphics are pretty and the xray cam can be amusing and fun, but this is counteracted by the clunky mechanics, often horrible animations, weak AI and general lack of polish on the entire thing. Still, the xray cam shots are amusing.Level design feels like limited paths with varying chances of getting pounced on by several enemies and shot into paste. The AI is perculiar to say the least. Enemies finding a dead body will become "suspicious" for a short time... then forget there is a problem. The noise-masking you can do by using noisy environmental objects to hide your rifle noises is a good idea, but was not executed as well as it could have been.UPDATE:After a bit more time with the game, I found that the multiplayer co-op aspect of it greatly increases the level of fun you can have with the game. Co-ordinating your shots with someone else or covering each other while sneaking around giving surprise stabs to the neck is fun and makes things worth your time. Single player might not be fantastic, but multiplayer makes up for it.

content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
												Sniper elite 3 is one of the most intricately designed games I’ve played it is just simply amazing from gameplay to graphics through and through. However I have only minor concerns here’s what I like and what I concern (keep in mind I have only played the game on sniper elite difficulty and easier difficulties tampers with AI intelligence and bullet physics also I haven’t finished the game yet I’m about maybe halfway through)•	Realistic bullet physics very well done also all snipers are completely different in stats and it can be very fun experimenting which one suits your play style and sniping skill (sniper elite / authentic difficulties) •	Extremely smart AI (sniper elite / authentic difficulties)•	Huge maps exploring is a must and just feels right very fruitful as well  •	Many different ways to handle objectives (however on sniper elite difficulty  going in guns blazing partially suicidal its possible but very hard, authentic difficulty you might as well just shoot yourself) •	wide-ranging  modifications and upgrades for each rifle •	well-designed all maps are unique from one another and a pass or bridge could have another hidden 5 different ways to cross for either a stealthy approach or a ambush point to gain an upper hand in a firefight•	gunplay is great if any then minor unnoticed problems•	bullet time allows you to see were your bullet hit and the damage it is doing its gruesomely attractive and extremely satisfying to watch for example your bullet ripping through the eye and peeling off the top of the skull of a Nazi officer or castrating a Nazi, yes there are testicle shots ashamed their no achievement for getting one   Concerns o	not many weapons only 4 snipers 4 submachine guns 3 pistols and the first pistol “welrod” is the best pistol the other 2 are trash o	the story and some voice acting is skeletal (:my opinion: but who f*ck cares gameplay is great and it give you an excuse to shoot Nazis) o	if you want more maps and guns you have to buy the dlc’sOverall 9.5/10

content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												This game is fun for several reasons.First of all, don't expect a realistic simulation of BEING a sniper. The realism is mainly present in the shooting physics - it doesn't really simulate how snipers actually operate because that probably wouldn't be as fun as what this game provides.The best feature, in my opinion, is the consistently fun and non-frustrating gameplay, which persists despite difficult-to-master mechanics. This comes from the nice save system and forgiving stealth mechanics. Being able to quick-save really changes the fun of this game, in my opinion. Instead of what happens in other stealth games where you make a mistake, everyone gets alerted, then you have to open up a menu, sit through a long loading screen, and start at the beginning of the level, you get an quick-save button which saves while you continue playing, so you can always save before you try something risky and just focus on the fun sniping mechanics and visuals. Also, one of the other problems that can happen in a lot of stealth games is that it's hard to keep track of your surroundings, so somebody might see you but you won't realize it until it's too late. This game provides subtle audio-cues and less subtle visual cues to let you know when you are about to be spotted.You might think that the aforementioned features make the game too easy or too simple, but I think it just lets you focus on what this game does best - being stealthy and sniping people. If you really like sniping in other FPS games (the feel of precision and power), you'll definitely like this game because it focuses on that one aspect of FPS. If you're concerned about having to spend more time sneaking around than shooting, you're in luck because even though you might alert everyone and have them go aggressive, you can still clear levels just by running and gunning and shooting everyone in sight.So, overall, I think this game is pretty fun.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 29, 2015
												Single player only review.SE3 is a 3rd person stealth shooter that focuses on sniping (duh!).It takes place during WW2, and unlike Wolfenstein, it doesn't really have any interesting characters or involving story.The gameplay, albeit linear,  is good though, and it could've been very good if it weren't for a few fundamental flaws. As the main attraction is sniping, the levels are large. They're also pretty and rendered with a very well performing engine. The main event in the visual department is the bullet cam kills, which shows the bullet penetrating the victim in x-ray vision, so you see the bones scatter etc. It's neat, and yes, it grows old pretty quick. Luckily it's skippable.There's not much voice acting, but what is there is ok. Sound effects are very good.My problems with the game are:- Spawning enemies. The premise of the game is to observe and plan. What friggin' use is that when enemies can spawn near by when a certain area is reached, or an objective is accomplished or you fire a shot that wasn't sound masked?! - All hail the sniper rifle. Naturally the devs want you to use the "title" weapon, but they really went too far by nerfing the other bullet weapons WAY into the unusable. You can't hit a barn from 3 feet with a Thompson rifle even while proning with a heart rate of 60. As soon as it became an option I carried a Panzershrek RPG instead.- The AI. I know AI is hard to do. AI in a stealth game is harder. This AI will lose a game of chess to a brick EVERY TIME.- Unclear mission objectives. Best example: "Overcome the temple defenders" with a map marker inside the temple actually means: "Go find a half-track vechicle across the map and destroy it and return here". Jesus effin' christ. If you're hooked on stealthy sniping, this is for you. If you just love 3rd person stealth shooters, buy a Metal Gear Solid game instead.73%

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 9, 2016
												POSTED: 17 SEPTEMBERI have played all 3 Sniper Elite's in the series and was excited to learn they are working on a 4th. I have also played the Zombie versions of the game (which I didn't like NEAR as much). Overall, this is my favorite in the series and it seems as each release gets more and more polished than the last. While I play single player 99% of the time, I have dabbled in the co-op multiplayer and it is fun but I do wish it allowed multiple snipers instead of the sniper/spotter setup currently. I realize this is technically more correct, we, as players, want to play as the sniper and when we are playing as spotter it feels we are just playing nice until our turn.I really only have a few gripes with the game that I can think of right now. First: (And this is a big one) you can't set your elevation on your scope. Every person that shoots firearms knows you can set your "zero" on your scope so that it is "dead-on" at a certain distance. Then, you can hold over or under depending on whether the target it closer or further. Second: This whole series has suffered from what I refer to as the "trigger effect" where enemies don't appear, or certain things happen until you hit a certain trigger. Usually the trigger is reaching a certain place on the map, or killing a certain person, or percentage of enemies. While not as pronounced as it was on the 2nd in the series, nothing like carefully scouting your approach, then moving forward and hitting a trigger point, and have enemies all around you. Often, once I figured out where that trigger point was, I moved forward until I triggered it, then ran back to my sniper nest and clear a path. Third: Enemies in vehicles see WAY to well. If you have ever been in an armored vehicle or tank, you will know that visibility is NOT their strong point. They should have excellent defense and firepower like they do in real life and do in the game but shouldn't be able to see you near as well unless near an enemy patrol. Fourth: Inconsistant mechanics regarding long range shooting alarming enemies. I have played the game 250+ hours, and still can't determine whether an enemy will hear my shots at a given place or distance except around broken generators and such. Incidentally, it seems logical that if backfiring generators at your location mask your sounds, you should be able to shoot a generator near the enemy and make it back firing then you could shoot towards him even if you are not by a generator any longer. (does that make sense?)A few more "mentions" of other things about the game I wish were different. Why can't we jump in the game?I wish you could turn off the wind, without turning off elevation. It is harder to "feel" the wind in a game. I had some occasional issues with the game doing a red flicker when SLI was enabled. This was the only game that ever did that. Normally, just changing the resolution and restarting it fixed it. Ironically, I could alternate between two resolutions and they both worked; AFTER the other one messed up. Every time you reload your side arm, it goes through the "chambering" animation. Just because you drop the magazine, and put in a full one, doesn't mean the chamber will be empty. Yes, there are a FEW firearms that the magazine is loaded from the top, usually with a "stripper clip" where you would potentially cycle it like that, but aside from the M1 Garand rifle and the Mauser C96 (which I don't remember any in the game), nothing should load like that. For a game that obviously desires for accuracy and realism, it seems like an odd oversight.Snipers don't fall for thrown rocks, no way to get them to move short of killing them.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 9, 2016
												Played for a few hours during a free weekend.The game plays well from a controls point of view. The quick menu is smooth, you have shortcuts for switching weapons, covering and vaulting are responsive. The only part that seems off is sprinting where you can't easily change direction.There's an element of customization where you can choose your loadout before every mission. Weapons and items unlock as you progress through the campaign, or by gathering collectibles and doing optional quests. You can even upgrade your rifle, though the stock rifle with the stock parts seems the most balanced.The graphics are good, although I find the sunlight overly white. There's also some weird pixelation when light shines through the leaves of a tree.Killing any enemy will probably result in a kill cam that traces the path of the bullet all the way to the enemy and through them. They're gory, fun, but repetitive. Fortunately you can skip them. Sometimes they look a bit blurry, especially the bone fragments and the blood.The game feels very easy. With the enemy difficulty set to the highest level, you can't help but feel overpowered. The AI is simply dumb. You can pick enemies one by one as long as you relocate between shots. They'll instantly forget that you wiped half their base if they can't see you anymore. Even exploding oil barrels next to them won't hold their attention for long. At many times I had enemies look right at me and have them take a good 3-4 seconds before they even start thinking of shooting me. In that time you can easily switch weapons, miss a shot or two and take your time to line up a headshot.In the end, I recommend the game because it's fun. You can choose to go stealthy and take enemies from behind without getting noticed, or you can shoot everything in sight with little to no consequences due to poor AI. It's a good way to spend a lazy weekend, but it's not a game to commit yourself too. Compared to Ghost Warrior (the first one), this game feels polished.

												Cool game, I like the stealth mechanics and the ambience.  Just a couple of things I hope they change by the next game:-Changeable over-the-shoulder view, because sometimes you need to look over the left one too-NPC dialogue, because the same 10 phrases, even in another language, are noticable after a while.  Make the NPCs come alive! Have them talk about their families back home, childhood memories, etc.  They don't know you're there, so why don't they loosen up a bit? (It might make people want to spare them too. Add to the emphasis on stealth rather than run n' gun)-Variable slow-mo cam occurence.  It gets stale pretty quickly.-Maps with more than one path to the objective.  I'm talking about a side road or something, not two boxes with a hole under them off to the side that you can crawl through.-More believable sound cover.  Sound cover should echo like a gunshot if it's going to cover a gunshot, not like someone is popping bubblewrap.Aside from these things, the game is really well put together.

content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												Take Sniper Elite v2 and copy paste it. Then screw with the physics and finally throw in a few maps that are laughably small considering this is a game about sniping. Get a voice actor with a badass voice for the 13 year olds and write a story so bland and predictable, that even Twilight seems to be written better. There you go, you created Sniper Elite 3. Ah and don't forget that the developers have obviously not even googled how actual bullet physics work. If in the dificulty settings you put the bullet drop to "realistic" you can have a good laugh looking at what they seem to think is realistic. Is this a high powered Sniper Rifle or a overly glorified Rubber band-powered bullet thrower? It's obvious the devs made this "bullet drop" ridiculously strong to compensate the fact that the maps are a joke for a sniping game. So essentially it's a worse version of Sniper Elite v2 with a crap story, crap physics and crap gameplay. If you hate yourself and want to torture yourself through the story then get this. If you're looking for a good game with a decent story and playing as a sniper then don't buy this pile of *****

												Take Sniper Elite v2 and copy paste it. Then screw with the physics and finally throw in a few maps that are laughably small considering this is a game about sniping. Get a voice actor with a badass voice for the 13 year olds and write a story so bland and predictable, that even Twilight seems to be written better. There you go, you created Sniper Elite 3. Ah and don't forget that the developers have obviously not even googled how actual bullet physics work. If in the dificulty settings you put the bullet drop to "realistic" you can have a good laugh looking at what they seem to think is realistic. Is this a high powered Sniper Rifle or a overly glorified Rubber band-powered bullet thrower? It's obvious the devs made this "bullet drop" ridiculously strong to compensate the fact that the maps are a joke for a sniping game. So essentially it's a worse version of Sniper Elite v2 with a crap story, crap physics and crap gameplay. If you hate yourself and want to torture yourself through the story then get this. If you're looking for a good game with a decent story and playing as a sniper then don't buy this pile of *****

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												This game is fun for several reasons.First of all, don't expect a realistic simulation of BEING a sniper. The realism is mainly present in the shooting physics - it doesn't really simulate how snipers actually operate because that probably wouldn't be as fun as what this game provides.The best feature, in my opinion, is the consistently fun and non-frustrating gameplay, which persists despite difficult-to-master mechanics. This comes from the nice save system and forgiving stealth mechanics. Being able to quick-save really changes the fun of this game, in my opinion. Instead of what happens in other stealth games where you make a mistake, everyone gets alerted, then you have to open up a menu, sit through a long loading screen, and start at the beginning of the level, you get an quick-save button which saves while you continue playing, so you can always save before you try something risky and just focus on the fun sniping mechanics and visuals. Also, one of the other problems that can happen in a lot of stealth games is that it's hard to keep track of your surroundings, so somebody might see you but you won't realize it until it's too late. This game provides subtle audio-cues and less subtle visual cues to let you know when you are about to be spotted.You might think that the aforementioned features make the game too easy or too simple, but I think it just lets you focus on what this game does best - being stealthy and sniping people. If you really like sniping in other FPS games (the feel of precision and power), you'll definitely like this game because it focuses on that one aspect of FPS. If you're concerned about having to spend more time sneaking around than shooting, you're in luck because even though you might alert everyone and have them go aggressive, you can still clear levels just by running and gunning and shooting everyone in sight.So, overall, I think this game is pretty fun.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 12, 2015
												Sniper Elite 3 takes the mechanics of its predecessors and refines them even further. The game is immediately more open than its predecessor in that there are more paths to take. A new relocate system forces you to think about your position and pick your targets accordingly. Its a engaging system that when you elude pursuers feels rewarding. In prior games you could sit in one spot and kill all the approaching guards and move onto the next area. Sniper Elite 3 builds tension. It also has a greater emphasis on using sound to mask your shots. This can range from communication towers, sabotaging generators or the weather itself. You have the same tools at your disposal as in other Sniper Elite games with a few new additions. You have trip mines, grenades, anti personel mines, landmines, etc. Sniper Elite 3 also features a robust progression system. Every kill regardless of mode grants you XP. And your level is across all modes so you never feel like you have to do things over just to progress in another mode. This progression unlocks extra weapons for one of your 4 loadouts. You can unlock weapons like a webley revolver, luger, Thompson, the italian carcano, an enfield, and even a panzerschreck. That said there are a few quibbles I have when it comes to the game's stealth melee takedown mechanics. In one mission I successfully circled a guard leaning against sand bags. But I was unable to perform a melee takedown to drag him over the sandbags. It feels like a curious omission and breaks the immersion. Another oddity is in that if you are hiding behind a corner and a guard walks up or spots you; you are unable to knife them. Instead it shows you clumsily and uselessly punch the enemy while he continues to shoot you. Thus you are forced to hose him with a Thompson breaking any chance you have of being discreet. Overall this third installment is an enjoyable one with a few questionable oddities. But with the number of collectibles, unlocks, and sandbox map design; there is enough here to still satisfy.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 12
												I enjoyed this game tremendously even though it's obviously got some lacking elements. I love stealth and sniping, and this game has plenty of both. It does surprise me that after 2 years, the DLC has a) not really been reduced in price, and b) apparently has hardly ever been seen based on the number of reviews of it. I'd pick them up just to have more fun with the game, but until the trio of mission-based DLC come down to maybe the price of one of them, that's off my list.Now: the good stuff!I enjoy the variety of fighting though I almost always find myself defaulting to my 'stealth, snipe, whoops - kill everything in sight, wait for enemies to relax, repeat' mode. I don't mind that at all, though I suspect some find it too repetitive. The locations are really nice and I would love to have a way to remove the UI and get first person in there, just for screenshot purposes. Killing fascists is always - ALWAYS - on my list of things to do. ALWAYS. There's a kind of satisfaction that comes from it that is kind of ... a guilty(?) pleasure.I found myself more and more liking the little bit of actual story we have - nice touches to the character even though he's mostly a blank slate (I didn't even know that his name was Karl... lol, because they don't actually SAY it anywhere). Plus his voice. mmm. His voice.Good musical cues, though at times the music overshadows any other sounds.Overall very easy and intuitive to play, though I still hate third person motion quite a bit, but that's on me not the game.The less good:I really want to be able to jump and explore. Unfortunately that just doesn't happen. However on the plus side of this is that the numerous ways you CAN explore the areas to complete your goals are a lot of fun.The sound editing is crappy, in that there's zero stereo sound cues, and that means in trying to hear directionally it's impossible to determine any locations of enemies. The chat that occasionally shows up is also weirdly triggered, because I'd already killed a number of enemies and then went through their chat trigger... so... a room full of dead guys and they're talking. O.oVirtually no story. Now, I'll give this one a pass because I didn't really get the game to have a story, I got it so I could shoot bad guys with a sniper rifle. :) Way too short. However also this gets a pass from me because the replay value is very strong, and the challenges pad the mission length. I don't play multiplayer so I probably won't get any of the other achievements or see any maps that might be mp exclusive, which is a bit of a shame. I'd love to be able to interact with the environment much more than I do. I'd like to pick things up, climb, shimmy under things, etc, and explore to my hearts' content, but that's not why the character is where he is.The .... bad? Well I suppose the one thing I might say is that it's still too expensive and the DLC should be folded into one lower price point to actually sell it. If you enjoy sniping and a variety of potential methods for doing the same 8 missions and challenge maps, highly recommend. Pick it up on sale, imo.

												GET IT ON STEAM SALE IMMEDIATELY!I am not sure if it is worthe the full price, to be honest. I haven't played much, but here are my opionions (I will update this over time).Pros:-Graphics are good, if a little bit fake-looking.-Model and textures are good so far.-Gameplay is fantastic (see caveat).-Visuals are unmatched.-Co-op and Multiplayer fun with friends.-Stealth is crucial.-AI seems intelligent so far.Cons:-Gameplay caveat; third person.-Ballistics are exaggerated (bullet drop is way too much, 10 inches from point of aim at 50 yards with an M1 Garand).-Weapon balancing is not realistic AT ALL. Caliber, barrel length, action type, and other variables have no consideration in the weapon stats of the game. This is the thing that really bugs me the most (I can forgive the other two Cons, maybe).-Weapon sounds are horrible, but then again all games are like that.Overall, I would not buy it for $50.00. For $15 on sale, it's a great deal.

content:
Posted: October 8, 2016
												Don't be fooled by the flood of "negative" reviews from people who played over the free weekend. That always happens with games that go free to play and it is frustrating to see a great game get bad press because some picky people decided to play game critic with a game they didn't even bother buying or playing for more than a weekend. This game is fantastically optimized and is downright fun to play. It runs really well on old hardware and has all of the great features of the previous games, but with improved graphics, a new location, and customizable loadouts. If you played and enjoyed the previous games in the series, you will very likely enjoy this game. Lets face it, this series is mostly about poking holes in people from very far away and watching their organs get shredded and fly out those holes in slow motion. This game does that very, very well.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 9, 2014
												“Sniper Elite 3” hits it mark with beautiful visuals, but misses giving players more content.	This is the third game in the Sniper Elite franchise and is easily the most detailed and innovated in the series. It is unfortunate that players won’t enjoy the game for long as it’s incredibly short experience.	Players take on the role of Karl Fairburn, an American secret agent sent to the African front during World War II. His mission is to learn about a secret ‘wonder weapon’ the Nazi’s are planning to create and prevent it from being built. The story for all the ‘Sniper Elite’ games has never been its strongest suit- it is forgettable and doesn’t affect the players experience at all.	Sniper Elite 3’s main feature is sniping, taking out enemies from a long distance with a rifle. Landing a good shot is difficult, as players have to deal with things like unsteady hands and wind resistance- simulating real world sniping. The game rewards players with a slow motion bullet cam as they show how the bullet enters the body and the damage it does to bone and muscles. The bullet cam does lose its amusement after a while but can be turned off.	Stealth has been greatly improved in this from previous games. Using rocks to distract enemies to lure them in to a landmine or getting them out of cover so you can land a shot. Players can hide their loud rifle shots by sniping near noisy generators or artillery pieces, making it easier to stay concealed. You are encouraged to stay hidden because the enemy out number you and can easily take you down. The enemy isn’t competent as they will investigate dead bodies of their comrades if seen. After a minute of searching they will give up looking for you and casually walk over their fellow soldier’s body-as if nothing happened. It does take out the immersion of the game when that happens.Another thing that is greatly improved in Elite 3 is the graphics. From beautiful sandy dunes to lush forest, the game highlights the beautiful environment in its African setting. Rocks and sand is finely detailed with cracks and rough edges, the trees and plants are bright and really pop out-especially looking at it through the rifle scope.There are multiplayer modes that pit players against each other or play co-operatively. Many of these modes aren’t too fun as you’ll be spending most of the time hiding and staring through the rifle scope looking for your friend as they will be doing the exact same thing.Players will be annoyed at how short the game is. It took me only three hours to complete the single player portion of the game. The dull multiplayer modes extended my experience by a few hours. Overall, it doesn’t have too much replay value. It is released on all consoles except the Wii U and priced at $49.99. You are better off waiting for this game to drop in price before taking aim to get it.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2014
												“Sniper Elite 3” hits it mark with beautiful visuals, but misses giving players more content.	This is the third game in the Sniper Elite franchise and is easily the most detailed and innovated in the series. It is unfortunate that players won’t enjoy the game for long as it’s incredibly short experience.	Players take on the role of Karl Fairburn, an American secret agent sent to the African front during World War II. His mission is to learn about a secret ‘wonder weapon’ the Nazi’s are planning to create and prevent it from being built. The story for all the ‘Sniper Elite’ games has never been its strongest suit- it is forgettable and doesn’t affect the players experience at all.	Sniper Elite 3’s main feature is sniping, taking out enemies from a long distance with a rifle. Landing a good shot is difficult, as players have to deal with things like unsteady hands and wind resistance- simulating real world sniping. The game rewards players with a slow motion bullet cam as they show how the bullet enters the body and the damage it does to bone and muscles. The bullet cam does lose its amusement after a while but can be turned off.	Stealth has been greatly improved in this from previous games. Using rocks to distract enemies to lure them in to a landmine or getting them out of cover so you can land a shot. Players can hide their loud rifle shots by sniping near noisy generators or artillery pieces, making it easier to stay concealed. You are encouraged to stay hidden because the enemy out number you and can easily take you down. The enemy isn’t competent as they will investigate dead bodies of their comrades if seen. After a minute of searching they will give up looking for you and casually walk over their fellow soldier’s body-as if nothing happened. It does take out the immersion of the game when that happens.Another thing that is greatly improved in Elite 3 is the graphics. From beautiful sandy dunes to lush forest, the game highlights the beautiful environment in its African setting. Rocks and sand is finely detailed with cracks and rough edges, the trees and plants are bright and really pop out-especially looking at it through the rifle scope.There are multiplayer modes that pit players against each other or play co-operatively. Many of these modes aren’t too fun as you’ll be spending most of the time hiding and staring through the rifle scope looking for your friend as they will be doing the exact same thing.Players will be annoyed at how short the game is. It took me only three hours to complete the single player portion of the game. The dull multiplayer modes extended my experience by a few hours. Overall, it doesn’t have too much replay value. It is released on all consoles except the Wii U and priced at $49.99. You are better off waiting for this game to drop in price before taking aim to get it.

content:
Posted: January 20, 2016
												Review: 4/10Although I had some fun playing this game in campaign mode, I don't really know if I could recommend it due to one BIG concern: the game is not ready. - Bugs here and there. Fall through walls, opponents getting stuck (either where they walk or in other opponents), strange things and actions in the game can happen when loading a savegame...- Kind of a stupid AI. Your opponents will oftentimes behave strangely and unrealistic. For example, when someone sees a guy shot to death, he gets suspicious and looks around. Then, when he's not seeing you, he will just keep walking about thinking this is nothing to worry about. Can't say that's very realistic. - The soundmasking of shots is not very consistent. A broken generator with its noise can act as soundmasking but other things which in real life could mask gun shots will not act as the same in the game.- The shooting/aiming had some problems too.- Some "obstacles" which you in real life just could climb over, walk over, or crawl under, is in the game unclimbable/unwalkable/uncrawlable. Instead you need to walk around etc. In short I would say that this is a game with a lot of potential and great fun, but the fact that it is NOT ready yet spoils it. Really hate it when I buy a game and discover that the developer didn't care of making the game ready before releasing it.If you would like to play a better sniper game I would recommend Sniper Ghost Warrior 2.

content:
Posted: February 8
												Sniper Elite 3 is at about the same level of quality as the previous game V2. It makes some improvements to the series like the much more open level design and a bigger focus on stealth but with those positives comes new negatives like mediocre ai, unrefined stealth mechanics, uninspired mission objectives and sometimes uninspired and uninteresting level design. It lacks the focus that V2 had because it is nowhere near as linear which can be seen as both a good thing and bad thing because you control the pacing and how those unscripted moments will play out. The story is worthless and not worth bringing any of your attention to just like V2, I also might have liked the game more if the protagonist actually had a personality. I feel like the game struggles with balancing out the difficulty as well, some of the enemy placements in the levels creates some awkward and frustrating difficulty spikes which forced me to quick save frequently which I’m very glad that they added, I think the developers knew the game just wouldn’t work very well without the ability to save whenever you want. The sniping is still well done and that’s the games saving grace in the end. 6/10 (Decent)

content:
Posted: February 6, 2015
												Sniper Elite 3 is a worthy successor of Sniper Elite V2. It has a lot of fun stealth/sniping elements, and the hit boxes works well. The x-ray bullet time cam when you snipe someone never gets old. Graphics are decent and the game doesn't feel TOO much console damaged, although things like the weapon and gear selection clearly was designed with console in mind, along with how you move around the map.The AI is as stupid as ANY sneak/sniping game. "Oh my friend died! ALERT!!!" 2 minutes later... "Probably nothing, let's go back to patrolling."I very much enjoyed being able to pickup and hide bodies and being able to mask your shots by using other noises to snipe silently, without a silencer.Overall, this is one of the better sniping games out there. If you enjoy stealth and sniping, give this one a chance.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
TL;DR - A frustratingly short game, aimed to make players pick up DLC in order to utilise uninteresting and repetitive mechanics. Don't buy at full price, or even half price.Let me start this by saying I'm a huge fan of Sniper Elite V2, and especially the Nazi Zombies series, and this game has not changed my perspective of those games. I really did want to enjoy this game - however, I cannot recommend people buy this game, especially at full price. I preordered (foolishly) and even though I received a discount by doing so, I still feel like I did not get my monies worth.As many new parts as there are to this game, I feel like it is still an incredibly short game. I cannot remember how many levels there are, but I am sure that there are no more than 10. And while these levels are expansive, the game itself feels so incredibly short. It feels like Rebellion tried to cram in as many little collectable things which don't matter at all - war diaries, playing cards, sniper nests. Collecting these seems tedious to me, and I have 0 interest in going back and replaying to collect them all.I really enjoy the levelling up system - who doesn't want to see themselves progress in front of their eyes? However, the updgrades and benefits seem miniscule and like they have little impact; I notice barely any difference in the muzzle, scope and trigger I use on my rifle. I still feel like the main way to play this game is to go tactically with a silenced Welrod, which takes away from the whole idea behind this game - lining up a shot and reaping the rewards with a gory, detailed cross-section killcam. And even the killcam feels dull - Rebellion claimed to have made them more detailed and realistic, but it doesn't come across that way at all to me - skulls still break apart in the same way, and there is 0 surface wounds. Why show all the destruction behind the scenes (so to speak) if I can't see it when I get close to the body?Still unsmart AI and game mechanics to do with stealth means that while levels may be huge, you are still pretty much forced to do things in x-way instead of having lots of options to complete a level. You can stamp and smash up a generator, which in turn creates noise when damage, but the AI pay no attention to this. Drop down from a ledge a little too far? Imagine trying to sneak up creaky stairs without waking up your parents, but instead of human parents you have bats for parents. And a further frustrating thing - as long as you stand beside a generator when you fire, you can kill anyone across the map and as long as noone sees the dead body, it'll be like it never happened. The audio system and gameplay mechanics seem totally unconnected.The mutiplayer seems like a further uninteresting aspect of the game. I believe that Sniper Elite should be built around the single player (and co-op) experience. It feels like a lot of actual good content was sacrificed to make way for the multiplayer. Especially when a lot of DLC is available on release - I understand companies need to make money, but it makes me as a customer feel undervalued and unappreciated.If this game is on sale at around £15, I would perhaps say pick up the game (or even more ideally, during a free weekend. You'd be more than able to complete the game in that time). But at 10.5 hours played (I completed this by the end of release weekend without any large amount of dedicated time spent playing), do not buy this full price. Without wishing to step on the toes of previous and earlier reviews, Rebellion seems to have adopted the Call of Duty/Battlefield strategy of draining as much cash out of the players through DLC, while drawing people in with superficial, repetitive "new" & "improved" features.

content:
Posted: February 23
												anyone with a intel HD 5500 graphics with an i-7 core this is the review for you.anyone wanting a good-decent review on the game this is the review for youIntel graphic details below, scrol past for my review on the game if you wantSniper Elite 3 is plable on a intel HD 5500 graphics with an i-7 core as the settings I had the game set to are below> Texture Detail - MED> Shadow Detail - LOW> Anisotropic Filtering - OFF> Supersampling - OFF> Anti-alasing - OFF> Draw Distance - LOWwith these setting I got an average of 25-30 FPS 40 FPS top sometimes 50 in some areas of the gameSniper Elite 3 was an interesting game to play not as challenging as Sniper Elite V2 with all its colectables but still a bit challenging for an enjoying gaming experince. it is a fun game, annoyingly it oddly crashes at times so I had to verify my game files now and again to play it again.X-ray kill games are a lot better and improved so much more from Sniper Elite V2. more open area to snipe from is good but shooting one then moving away then going back to the same spot makes the game a bit to easy and easy to beat in a way. the challenges are good and make the game rather more enjoying to play as you try take on the challenges set for you. being able to customise your Sniper in Sniper Elite 3 is a great unlike in sniper elite V2 you couldn't. one decent thing about Sniper Elite 3 is that it wants you to take it seriously. Bushes will provide extra cover, loud noises will cover your shots, dark areas provide extra concealment, and enemies react to nearby sounds to determine your location. It tries to be realistic but some of the features make it so unrealistic that theres no point trying to go with being stealthly or trying to hide from the enemy at first I was trying to do stealth and take them out all quitely until I relised I can just kill them all off loud run off somewhere and they wouldn't care no more so thats a bit of a let down on the game but if you're new to sniper elite and never played it before then you're welcome to try it out for your self and see what you think.me well I'm gonna recommend this game for any intel graphics HD 5500 gamers that are looking for a good-decend game to play and for any sniper elite fans then my recommendation is a bit of a toss up as I really enjoyed sniper elite V2 and 3 but found sniper elite 3 fell a bit short on what it could of been like. I hope this review is useful to anyone reading this and its helped their thoughts on thinking about getting the game or not.

content:
Posted: November 5, 2015
												I had really high co-op hopes for this game. The asymmetric modes sounded fun and being able to play through the whole campaign with a buddy really sold me on it.Unfortunately, the best feature of the game is basically not present in co-op -- the x-ray cam. I totally understand that some people would get annoyed if the game was slowing down all the time for shots. But isn't that why there's the ability to adjust the frequency in single player? Removing the option entirely from multiplayer is extremely disappointing. I want to be able to compete with my buddy to see who can make the craziest shots.Maybe it's just my disappointment but the game feels like a pretty big letdown without this feature. I won't be purchasing any additional Sniper Elite titles if this isn't included.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
												Remember there was a time that it was fun to shoot hordes of Nazis in shooter games ? Well, either that time has passed or I got too old for it and shot way too many Nazis to get bored of it. Eventhough I picked it on a sale for dirt cheap, this game barely deserves the price. It has nice visuals and the infamous bullet cam but that's pretty much it. Desert is a nice touch but it has near to no change than the previous game so yeah, I'd say spend your money elsewhere. It's very repetitive and you do the same thing in every mission. It has many historical inaccuracies but I guess that's why it's a game. So yeah, then again if you do love to shoot around random dudes to spend time, I guess it'd be up to your street. These though are my opinions. If I have to rate this I guess I'd give it a 4-5/10.

content:
Posted: November 5, 2015
												I had really high co-op hopes for this game. The asymmetric modes sounded fun and being able to play through the whole campaign with a buddy really sold me on it.Unfortunately, the best feature of the game is basically not present in co-op -- the x-ray cam. I totally understand that some people would get annoyed if the game was slowing down all the time for shots. But isn't that why there's the ability to adjust the frequency in single player? Removing the option entirely from multiplayer is extremely disappointing. I want to be able to compete with my buddy to see who can make the craziest shots.Maybe it's just my disappointment but the game feels like a pretty big letdown without this feature. I won't be purchasing any additional Sniper Elite titles if this isn't included.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
												Remember there was a time that it was fun to shoot hordes of Nazis in shooter games ? Well, either that time has passed or I got too old for it and shot way too many Nazis to get bored of it. Eventhough I picked it on a sale for dirt cheap, this game barely deserves the price. It has nice visuals and the infamous bullet cam but that's pretty much it. Desert is a nice touch but it has near to no change than the previous game so yeah, I'd say spend your money elsewhere. It's very repetitive and you do the same thing in every mission. It has many historical inaccuracies but I guess that's why it's a game. So yeah, then again if you do love to shoot around random dudes to spend time, I guess it'd be up to your street. These though are my opinions. If I have to rate this I guess I'd give it a 4-5/10.

content:
Posted: February 23
												anyone with a intel HD 5500 graphics with an i-7 core this is the review for you.anyone wanting a good-decent review on the game this is the review for youIntel graphic details below, scrol past for my review on the game if you wantSniper Elite 3 is plable on a intel HD 5500 graphics with an i-7 core as the settings I had the game set to are below> Texture Detail - MED> Shadow Detail - LOW> Anisotropic Filtering - OFF> Supersampling - OFF> Anti-alasing - OFF> Draw Distance - LOWwith these setting I got an average of 25-30 FPS 40 FPS top sometimes 50 in some areas of the gameSniper Elite 3 was an interesting game to play not as challenging as Sniper Elite V2 with all its colectables but still a bit challenging for an enjoying gaming experince. it is a fun game, annoyingly it oddly crashes at times so I had to verify my game files now and again to play it again.X-ray kill games are a lot better and improved so much more from Sniper Elite V2. more open area to snipe from is good but shooting one then moving away then going back to the same spot makes the game a bit to easy and easy to beat in a way. the challenges are good and make the game rather more enjoying to play as you try take on the challenges set for you. being able to customise your Sniper in Sniper Elite 3 is a great unlike in sniper elite V2 you couldn't. one decent thing about Sniper Elite 3 is that it wants you to take it seriously. Bushes will provide extra cover, loud noises will cover your shots, dark areas provide extra concealment, and enemies react to nearby sounds to determine your location. It tries to be realistic but some of the features make it so unrealistic that theres no point trying to go with being stealthly or trying to hide from the enemy at first I was trying to do stealth and take them out all quitely until I relised I can just kill them all off loud run off somewhere and they wouldn't care no more so thats a bit of a let down on the game but if you're new to sniper elite and never played it before then you're welcome to try it out for your self and see what you think.me well I'm gonna recommend this game for any intel graphics HD 5500 gamers that are looking for a good-decend game to play and for any sniper elite fans then my recommendation is a bit of a toss up as I really enjoyed sniper elite V2 and 3 but found sniper elite 3 fell a bit short on what it could of been like. I hope this review is useful to anyone reading this and its helped their thoughts on thinking about getting the game or not.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2015
												The headshot, nutshot, lungshot and everyshot has returned to us in Sniper elite 3. Now Good things about the new game more coop gameplay with friends more heads popping and of course slowmo kill cams.Although in this installment Bullet cams have been reduced drastically its still a fair game.ok to be fair the good and the bad scenarios...The good:        Still has working coop.No connection issues.Ran great on a average computer.The kill cams are improved *slightly*Fun assortment of weapons.The bad: Ragdolls falling into the world. *Didn't happen all very much in my playthrough but was enough to notice.*A sad thing I missed the Killcams in slow mo on every kill. *To some it might seem monotinous but thats one of the reasons we play these sniper elite games.* The price tag, for a 40 dollar game you would expect atleast a 6 to 10 hour campaign for what we pay.  We got pretty much 5 hours exactly out of a coop campaign with taking a few minutes to get up grab a drink use the restroom and mess around searching for some secrets and the optional missions.All in all this review may not help alot of people but the facts are if you love the series such as myself and my coop  partner then you would enjoy this game. There is a lvl 50 cap which we only hit lvl 10 / 11 so there is replayability for sure to get those stats up and unlocks.Final rating would be 7/10

content:
Posted: February 6, 2015
												First impressions of Sniper Elite III is really good.The graphics and sound are good , and the game offers intense excitement . While you plow through the Germans. However I find this not very difficult and it took me about an hour to get through 2½ mission.The sturgeon residual plus is definitely the new " bullet - time system " is really impressive ! And probably the most residual news in the game .Would not think the game is full price 45.99 worth and have even bought it it - 70 % ie 13.99 where I thought it is incredibly good .The game , I find a little limited in the courts and would very much like to see a more free world where you greater freedom to decide which way you would take. In this game there is often only one way that you then are forced to follow .Do you love one person shooter , this is definitely a game for you !From 1-10 I'll give it 7

content:
Posted: November 16, 2014
												What i like about Sniper 3 is you are free to take your time and really plan taking down a large group of enemiea undetected. No time limits means you can behave like a real sniper and lie in wait for ages until the time to shoot the kill arrives for you with no constraints telling you to hurry up like a ticking clock but this is present in a very minor part of the game for specific mission(s). What i don't like is although they have improved the X-ray kill cams with better muscle and bone fragmentations they have taken out one or two kill hit zones that were in the previous Sniper Elite V2 game - for example in Sniper V2 if you were accurate enough you could shoot and dismember the fingers of an enemy soldier whilst he was unaware of your prescence and smoking a ciggy, yawning or drinking from something....even coughing - as long as his hands were raised to that zone pretty much there was a chance of this happening which was a very satisfying thing to achieve in my opinion.......BRING IT BACK (in an update hopefully) AND I'LL GIVE A FULL STAR RATING TO THIS GAME.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2015
												Okay, where to start?!First: this game is OKAY is fine!The grafics are nice, the enemies quite smart and the weapon physics are great!There will be some tense firefights and "hide and seek moments", too. Unfortunately that's it...And I did expect a lot more!! I expected a great story and a lot more of variation in this game (tubular  levels!!). Getting to blow up a tank was the most relieving moment after 11 hours of gaming and sniping down nazis one by one until the way is clear. Especially I missed some kind of tutorial, which teaches you how to aim under the influence of wind and long-range shots. Also there are few weapons which you can really use (Only one silenced pistol?!? Sam Fisher wouldn't be proud!) and the modifications and gadgets are kind of useless (Why use flint and stone or a rock to lure enemies only to crash around after this while shooting, when you can blow them up with a "coincidentally standing around" can of explosives or fuel?!).The lesson is clear: 45,99 € is waaaay too much for this game...Wait for a sale (got it for 9,19 €) and keep your expectations low! PS: Sadly there is no "Meh-button"!!Update I: There really are no changes in gameplay: Shoot, run, shoot, hide, oh a tank: Shoot, boom, hide, ...Also the gore isn't as mind blowing and controversial as the trailer promised,...The kill cam is quite funny and a bit disturbing (Shoot the nazis in the nuts, yeah!), but there are no exit wounds and it's kind of dumb that there is a x-ray kill cam, but when you blow up someone there isn't any dismemberment.Update II: I finished the game…after 16 hours…and I did play on "Elite"...Good, that I didn’t pay the full price!The end was quite disappointing, too. Very loveless and sudden. Killing Vahlen wasn’t really satisfying, because he was not really presented as evil and a danger to yourself (actually, what is the name of the character??! Either he has no name or I don’t remember it! Last one is the most likely possibility!!). So all in all. All in all my conclusion is definite: An empty shell of a game!! Much Ado About Nothing! All bark but no bite.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												DO NOT GET THIS GAME!!!youve been warned.This game has MANY glitches and graphical errors. I have a very good computer able to handle most games on ultra.This game alone has crashed more than all my other games combined... i have alot.If you DO get this game, Do not look at it as the sequel to the previous game because the "Optional stealth" is a load of bullocks and the game actually penalizes you for NOT playing the way it wants you to.Yes the bullet ballistics are gorgeous, but on Ultra graphics it glitches and ends up crashing the game."Visually stunning detail" Nope. None of that. Just basic copy and pasted landscapes. Oh and not to forget invisible walls, EVERYWHERE.Im not saying this game sucks, it doesnt. It just is worth $50. NOT BY A "LONG SHOT" haha oh did i mention the "long shots"? no?Long shots are supposed to be a collectible, but instead they are actual people you have to shoot in order to get the achievment. Its actually pretty cool, IF IT WASNT SO ♥♥♥♥ING HARD. Now bullet ballistics are supposed to engage whenever you hit a vital organ. Ive barely gotten any ballistics and i ALWAYS hit a vital organ (Chest shots usually hit an organ in your chest and will kill you).Lets not forget those amazing explosions. Oh you wanna light one wil your flint and steel? go ahead! Wanna shoot it with any gun? Go ahead!! wanna throw a gernade at it and have double the explosion? ♥♥♥♥ YOU LOGIC!!! This usually ends up either crashing your game or doesnt work. One last thing: If you buy this game, Dont set the difficulty past marksman. This will glitch most of the enemies and make them near impossible to kill. Oh and have fun... if thats even possible <3

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												Welcome to the DLC bandwagon.What's improved, compared to SE v2:- better graphics- opened environments, larger maps (in campaign and in coop/mp)- some stealth mechanics: foliage, suppressed weaponry, sound masking, etc- weapon & character customization (based on unlocks and finding weapon parts in campaign mode)- "improved" x-ray (some body organs added)CONS:- buggish/glitched bullet cam- feels like a console port- lazy 3rd person FOV- content lackluster: few weapons, few attachments, few maps- dumb AI: no actual improvements, even on highest difficulties, where AI is barely challenging (aimbot enabled)The story is a lackluster, a generic mixup, just as in the previous Sniper Elite games, nothing interesting.-----Overall, this is SE3 in a nutshell, an unfinished and unoptimized game, that is looking to overly "entertain" the playing community with:- day 1 DLCs that should have been integrated/released for all, but was instead a preorder gimmick- sequential DLC programme: season pass shenanigans-----The devs didn't learn anything from their previous releases. The PR marketing & hype is still strong, but the game content and season pass temptation aren't enough to save the downfall of the series.Do not buy this game if:- you want to experience content-drips (over a period of time, via DLCs)- you hate overpriced skins & weapons

content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												Let me start by saying that I played and loved the first two Sniper Elite games, they gave me the sniping experience no other games could deliver at the time. Sniper Elite 3 has better graphics, customizable loadouts, and fancy new maps, but it fails to improve upon the gameplay experience. What I mean by that is enemies can see you behind cover, the third-person controls feel a bit clunky, and in some situations (like in mission 5) enemies will not render until you get to where the game wants you to be. These problems can be very frustrating, especially in a stealth based sniping game. The game is still fun as long as you play it "the right way", it just seems a bit linear to me.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2015
												Have you played and enjoyed Sniper Elite 1 and 2? Then you won't enjoy this one.Pro:  Multiplayer Coop Missions make the game fairly fun because you can rant with a friend about the bugs and horrible logic.Contra:  Very very basic AI logic. Like a Splinter Cell game from 2005. Also some enemy sees you behind wall bugs.  Re-location is also very basic logic. Make hell of noise, kill 17 people, then go 30m aways from that, wait 10 seconds, and enemies forget anything happened.  No multiple ways to achieve goals. Only larger corridors how to get there.  Audio design is a horribly disfigured ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ baby of good audio design. (I can hear an enemy 300m away loud and clear, so I always have to sneak because I assume he's in 20m range.  Masked shots are realistic for a 4 year old child. If a small generator makes noise in a 10m radius near me, I can kill enemies 300m away without any AI hearing the shot. Is even more noticable in MP because if other player sits amongst the enemies, the shot can be clearly heard like in real life. A sniper rifle is way louder than a generator 300m away. What the hell?  Map border killzones with no warning, just getting damage until dead. Very very poor.I could list some more, instead I just give you the conclusion:This game looks and feels as if it was made by an Indie developer that bought some high quality assets(models, image effects, etc.) and threw some scripts in there. The focus is on graphics.Fun factor: 1/10, 4/10 when in multiplayer.Replayability value: None.Price/performance: Very very bad.Realism: 1/10Frustration: 9/10

content:
Posted: June 28, 2015
												A huge improvement over 2, 3 gives you big levels to actual stealth around and snipe in. Stealth mechanics have been really improved with the relocation mechanic, which allows you to use hit and run tactics to avoid detection. It still does have its problems though, sometimes it feels like a killshot is whenever the game feels like it if you're not aiming for the head, the game doesn't autosave so you need to keep track of that, and enemies sometimes spot you when they shouldn't. It's a still fun game though and definitely worth picking it up on sale.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												I've played a bunch of sniper games, and this is probably the first one where I've really felt like I was a sniper. If you're careful, you can sit in a nest for 10 or 20 minutes just picking guys off. Everything has been improved over the previous game. The graphics and x-rays got a boost, of course, but also the stealth system is much, much better, the maps are wide open with multiple approaches, no more magical trigger-spawned enemies, new progression system, rifle customization... the list goes on and on. Probably the only downside is the limited number of missions available, but they play so differently each time you'll want to repeat them. Definitely a must have for any fan of shooting stuff or stealth action games.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												Aaah, Sniper Elite 3, the game I wanted since I played Sniper Elite 2 and Zombie Army. Had it on my wishlist for +/- 6 months or so, but waited and got it now in the summer sale !GeneralI'm not even halfway the game and I like it more than Sniper Elite 2. Sniper Elite 3 is located in Afrika and it has more features; the levels are way more bigger and you really need to plan and execute it carefully. Observing, planning and executing is they key in every. single. level. These 3 things doesn't matter in which difficulty you're playing. You need these 3 things in every difficulty level. The revamped and (new) features are also great !FeaturesThe details are absolutely stunning, and as I said the new features are also. You can customize your rifle, and choose/edit loadouts before playing a level. The returning x-ray kill camera is what I love the most; the new thing about this is the x-ray camera for vehicles - watch the bullet crashing into the engine and see how it explodes - You can also edit how you wanna use the x-ray camera in the settings (or if you don't like the x-ray you even can disable it). There's also a new radial menu where you see your equipement and select it if you need it. Furthermore, and i like this feature too, is when you get spotted you should prelocate to a new position to continue the execute part - and that's what the game says when you get spot, which is ... nice and realistic. And next to all this you can level up your rank to unlock more weapons/equipment. There are way more features, but that's up to you if you wanna see them or not ;)The only negative note I have to add is ... If the game is located in afrika, then why are there all germans in the game. I mean it's okay but eh ? ConclusionIf you like using a sniper, play games with a great story, apply your tactic skill or if you just wanna blow people's head off with a bullet camera then get this game.It's simple amazing ...I do not have any DLC and I didn't played co-op/multiplayer (yet)

												I do enjoy the gameplay, it can be fun and somewhat of a challenge (depending on the difficulty setting).  The one big thing that turned me off, however, is the lack of content included in the vanilla game. I've never seen a shooting game with so few guns.  It turns me off, big time when I see all of this DLC for sale so shortly after release day.  The campaign is short, and only 2 horde style maps, and they both look and play the same.  There are positives, for sure: the game looks pretty good, and the x-ray cam can really give some good screen shots.One other negative, that has gotten better due to a patch or two is/was the unpredictable aiming when you are close to a window or ledge.  Bullets woulld not hit the target even though the crosshair is spot on.  Overall, I can not recommend this game at it's current price; once it drops below $20 I could honestly say that I would change my  recommendation

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
												Actually, Sniper Elite 3 is a very satisfying sniper game with big open levels and adequate stealth system, All sniper rifles (with DLCs there are 10 or more of them) have different characteristics to suit any type of player + they can be customized in terms of scope (including the scope pattern), grip, muzzle, etc.  There is no more stupid "strawberry jam" regeneration, there are medkits now. There are many optional objectives to complete (e.g. locate a visiting general and assassinate him) while completing the main misison. All of this makes the game highly replayable. In other words, it's a big leap from the V2 in terms of gameplay and the game can boast good optimisation. I highly recommend playing it on higher difficulty levels (Sniper Elite and higher) with most of the HUD turned off to have your skills challenged.  The only problem is that Season Pass is really required to get the biggest kick from the game. It covers all the released DLCs, though - 4 mission packs (Hunt the Grey Wolf + 3 Save Churchill missions), 5 weapon packs (tons of all kinds of weapons that make choosing your pre-mission loadout really interesting). MP is good too, but I'm more of the single-player guy, so I can't adequately review it. I could have given SE 3 the score of 9/10, but for the greediness of devs who sold cut content, I can rate it only 7.5/10. In terms of gameplay it is absolutely great, so try to get the game and the season pass when there will be a good discount (e.g. Steam Summer Sale). It will be definitely worth your money. P.S. At the moment of posting the review I've completed 3 levels in 8 hours. I really took my time and enjoyed the hell out of them. There are many more to beat and I'm going to utilize the same approach for the rest of the game. P.P.S. African deserts are beautiful at night.

content:
Posted: February 13, 2016
												This is without doubt the worst game i have ever played in my life.The name is misleading for starters. First word, sniper, is very incorrect as you constantly get penalised for using the sniper rifles. Most levels only have two or three areas where noise covers the rifles sound (some levels only have one though, like the kill hitler mission) an these locations are only good for one of two kills before you have to move on. Also to me sniper kind of implies long range kills, like shooting someone several hundred meters away. However my longest kill is around 200 meters which isnt really very far at all. Second word, elite, once again suggests that were in control of a highly skilled soldier. However i seemed to have to play as a soldier who cant run for more than a few meters, seems to have some illness that makes his arms shake/body twitch, and has difficulty shooting a hostile soldier at 10m. How this guy got sniper training is beond me, I guess he found a sniper rifle early in the war and no-one thought to question him having it. The mass inaccuracy of the sidearms is just mind boggling, and i cant believe anyone would be that inept at shooting, military or not.Gameplay wise the game plays like a crap version of metal gear solid. You sneak around a few african locations shooting people at close range with the silenced pistol, the only gun thats sort of usable for the most part of the game. The hostiles dont seem that bothered about you being there and dont seem that bothered about catching you. I dont speak german but im guessing most the germans go 'Oh look, that british sniper shot hans, but i cant see any snipers so i guess things are fine and we should go back to standing around.' The game doesnt even replace fallen guards or raise the alarm on discovery so hiding the bodes is a complete waste of time. When the german soldiers do actually find you, maybe you used your sniper rilfe, bad player your sniper rifle is just too look at, they either telepathically tell everyone where you are leading to the whole base looking for you for a few minutes before deciding you've probably gone home and go back to slacking off. Or they just stare at you for several seconds before raising the alarm, which brings a few soldiers over to have a quick look for you. Theres a few other things that really bring this game down and the bullet balistics and the kill cam mechanic doesnt really salvage this game. After the first level the game is basically sneak here, then sneak there, then sneak away. With really boring (assassinate the guy in a truck which can basically only be done with mines) or pointless side objectives (disable the spotlights, that you can only disable after sneaking past them) was the final nail in the coffin for me for me. Game has so many good ideas, but they're just awfully done.

												Sniper Elite III has the worst multiplayer I have ever been in. The graphics are beautiful and the maps are cool but, the gameplay consists on laying on yuour stomach trying to look around by panning the mouse to look over the top of your monitor  past whatever cover you're in so you dont get shot.  So basically theres a bunch of living people all laying on their balls for 45 minutes to an hour not doing a thing. Its basically an action packed "lay down, and wait for someone to make the mistake of getting up" to run so everyone can take turns shooting at them. Also then you respawn and since no one else has died you have to then run to find a new space to hide. Guess what you're probably gonna die trying to get there too. If you like games that simulates an outdoor nap where the punishment for waking up is death, then Sniper Elite III is for you! *Sleeping bag not included*

content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
												Another entry in the Sniper Elite franchise. And boy, it's a great one.Story: The story might not feel very deep, but it works.Graphics: The graphics are absolutely fantastic. Look at the beautiful enviroments of North Africa. Definatively Scenery Porn (look it up on Tv tropes). The character models also look very good. Even on low settings it's impressive.Gameplay: The gameplay is in my opinion, improved a bit from V2. While regenerating health still exists, now it will only fill up to a certain point of your lifebar, anymore injuries than that will require bandages or medpacks to heal. The shooting still works very nice. One flaw though is that they removed the cover system from V2 (press Q), but so far it hasn't been affecting me that much. The A.I shows some improvement from V2, they will now react more to suspicious stuff, like gunfire and dead bodies. If you kill a soldier, they will start searching for you, and will find you eventually unless you relocate. You can also occasionally find weapon parts or upgrades for your weapons which can be used to modify your weapons.Music: The music is, like V2, epic and well made. You can even occasionally hear songs from V2 on the radios in some missions.Overall, Sniper Elite 3 is worth the money. If you liked V2, you will enjoy 3 as well.Also for the last, it has trading cards, and the X-Ray killcams are just absolutely AWESOME (shooting an enemy in some parts of the head will even DESTROY parts of the cranium).9/10.

content:
Posted: April 23
												A qualified recommendation.  This game felt like a shorter, less interesting revamp of Sniper Elite V2.  Which is weird because Steam says I played 26 hours in SE3 and only 16.8 in SE2.  Maybe it's because I spent so much time in Sniper Elite 3 sneaking around and plinking with my silenced pistol instead of doing what the game is named after.I suppose that's on me.  A lot of the levels suggest a stealthy approach but it's not really necessary.  The AI is pretty bad, so you're expected to kill a few soldiers, move positions, and the survivors will forget you were ever there.  Even if they march across the corpses of their buddies while on patrol.This game takes place in northern Africa so the levels are mostly wide open deserts and generally not that interesting.  I was surprised when the game ended because it wasn't a big spectacular finish, just another dull mission.

content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
												For me, personally:PRO:-Good looking game. Textures are off in some places but that's not a huge deal.-It can get very brutal in a high difficulty.-They learned after SE:v2 and improved a lot of things.-Weapons and how you can have a tailored to you variety. (mostly)-I wouldn't say it's a long game, but it's not really short either. Nice middle ground.-A lot of the time, movements are predictable - but there has been the odd time where I have been caught out and seen.-I have came across only 1 bug - ONE - which was easily resolved by restarting the level. This can be a con, but to me it's not.-Cinematics are short and sweet, but can be skipped anyway.CON:-Sound and sound masking seem to still be quite off and unrealistic.-Night missions; enemies can see like it's day, but for someone like me that uses low contrast for ambiance can't see them.-Although I said weapons can be tailored, it's still a choice between this, that or the other. You can't be a run and gun person effeciently.-I feel the scope and the aim helper are off sometimes. The helper said I had a hit, I shoot, and the bullet flies above or past them. (Note: I had this very few times. This could be just a mechanic to not make it a faceroll? No idea)-Killed a guard, someone found the body. That someone just looks around, shrugs their shoulders and carries on patrol. No alarms or searching the area or at least gave the corpse a cup of tea. Nope, like nothing happened.-You get seen or heard from a shot and get chased to where you were last. Relocate, get an all clear and everyone just goes back to normal... again like nothing happened. This universe plays devilish tricks, I tell ye.That's all I can think of for now. Do I think the price tag is worth the game? drop the price to £29.99 and then yes, it would be VERY worth the money I would think.TL;DR: IMO, a very good game, but has it's offsets by AI and sound masking.
