												PLayed the game for about 10 minutes on hard difficulty. Super dramatic introduction that places you in the middle of action? Check.Natural shake on scope? Check.Wind factor influencing projectile direction? Check.Interesting heart beat mechanic influencing scope steadiness based on stress? Check.Everything great so far, except:HUGE♥♥♥♥♥MARKER ON EVERY ENEMY'S  HEAD, ON EVERY OBJECTIVE, BOTH IN VIEW AND ON MINIMAP? F***** CHECKWhat's the point of making a stealthy sniper game if you mark every enemy with a big "LOOK HERE'S OVER HERE!" symbol that you cannot disable in options? Really? Where's the challenge? Why does my character bother to carry binoculars when he is a telepathic wizard who knows where all his foes are hiding?I instantly dropped the game and uninstalled it. Buyer's remorse. Now, Project I.G.I... now THERE'S a proper sniper game. That old grandfather of sniper games released in 2000 is still far more immersive than this♥♥♥♥♥♥

												I've never played the first two games, so I cannot attest to the quality of this game compared to the others. However, this was a really fun game. I love the x-ray bullet thing, however I spent more time skulking around and hiding bodies than actually sniping. The game is visually impressive but I would have rather spent more time sniping. I also wish the game had more guns and that gun ugrades were faster to unlock. I usually got the first upgrade for a gun right when I'd unlock the next gun, so the upgrades were pointless until I unlocked the best gun and stuck with it long enough. While there's a lot that could be improved, It's still a fun game but not worth more than $30. Wait until a steam sale.

content:
Posted: March 9, 2015
												Yeah, third person with gory sniping (you get a MRI scan for everyone you snipe showing exploing skulls and spleens). Basically it's a sneak around game, be patient, be silent. The game gives the idea of Far Cry freedom, but is pretty much on rails to be honest. Flaky in 3D, although ok to play with. Have completed the first mission in three sittings (I don't play much these days), and persuaded me to drop 25 quid on the season pass, for all the DLC - Hitler / Churchill missions and some guns to improve your loadout. LIttle clumsy in play style, Lara Croft did it better, but nice little shooter that's isn't in your face, and rewards if not demands... patience and a little planning. Next sale, get it, it's good!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
												Not going to discuss DLC. If you want it, get it. The game should only be judged for what it is, and likewise with the DLC. I am also not going to comment on the multiplayer aspect, just because I haven't tried it and don't really want to. It looks like there are always a few games going strong, but overall it is not very busy.+ Game length is pretty good, and open missions bring some replayability.+ Purist sniping is rewarding and not overly complicated. Likewise, if you want aim-assist, you still feel badass+ Looks pretty good aside from zoom blurring+ AI, sniping realism, and UI assistance options are independently customizable. Although there are only three settings for each, nothing in-depth+ Stealth system is good and works fine for what it is, "but"+/- Not very realistic. Stealth, AI, and many mechanics are too video game-y. As serious as the game takes itself (super gruffy mcsniper man gotta save arfica or whoever it was), it is not a realistic stealth game, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing unless you don't like that. The sniping alone may be realistic, though. I don't know, I'm not a sniper. But it emulates it well, at least. bullet drop, wind speed, yadda yadda. actually no yadda yadda, that's it I think.- Poor weapon variety (four sniper rifles in a sniping game?)- I mentioned AI is too video game-y, but I think it is so in a bad way.SE3 is a pretty good recommendation for someone who is interested in a stealth and/or sniping game that is easy to get into and easy to enjoy. It has become a little more accessible than SE2 (and like pop music compared to the first game being like black metal), but improves on the framework a LOT. My first playthrough alone is/was almost 20 hours, but the map design is pretty well done and you should be able to replay the game a couple of times and it will still feel like a different experience, especially if you practice different play styles (run and gun, booby trapped house of horror, cat and mouse, pure stealth, etc). I think there are like 8 missions in all? 8 to 10.There is nothing fancy about the stealth. It is simple and works (mostly). No parkour, pseudo-platforming, or anything remarkable. It is sight and sound-based. You crouch, go prone, hide in grass, shadows, or behind something. Instant kill enemies from behind, shoot em with a silenced pistol, take them out with a trap, or mask your shot with environmental noise. The automatic cover system is pretty seamless and I don't think it has ever frustrated me in the least. Very well implemented. I'm kind of disappointed there is no over-cover silent kill. If a guy was leaning up against a short wall and you were behind him: nope. sorry. You can hide and scurry off, and the enemy will stay pinned down assuming you are still active in your previous location (you'll see a ghost of your character, signifying you can relocate).The AI regularly switches between omniscient and brain-dead. I think that is very, very bad, but I enjoy the game regardless, and personally it's more comical and inexcusable. An enemy will hear you running in an underground bunker beneath them...but they won't see you kill a guy right in front of them 50 meters out. They will hear you walking on a roof above them and go investigate with weapons ready... even though one of their buddies was just walking around up there before I killed him undetected. They will hear you running a couple of blocks away...but they won't hear the guy who just got shot through the helmet grunt and slump to the ground five feet to the side of them. They won't be alerted by explosive traps that go off outside of combat unless they are very close.Some of the other mechanics in the game bothered me at first, too, but I quickly got over it. Sound masking makes some sense, but that logic isn't applicable to every situation. I can certainly understand shooting undetected when a plane passes low overhead, but not when some piece of machinery grunts and your gun is clearly much louder and sounds completely different (Like a gun, you know what I mean?). The sound masking is in relation to YOUR position, and never the enemy's. So when a loud noise happens near them, they will still hear you shooting just fine. Oh, and the AI will never ever see nor hear your bullet hit anybody or anything, no matter how close it is and even if it is in their field of vision.A couple bugs, but overall the game is very stable. One problem, a HUGE problem at some points, is that loading into a game will make a noise at your location. I don't know if it spawns you slightly above the ground and it's a dropping noise, or what. But it actually "broke" my mission once when I had an objective where I could NOT be detected because yaknow I was eavesdropping on something important. I saved on a platform above the conversation, and when I loaded into it again after messing something up, I alerted them with every single attempt. Not cool.Zooming in with your rifle or binoculars will make many foreground or background areas quite blurry until you aim at them and clear them up. I thought it was intentional at first, but it really looks like annoying texture bugs to me. Unsure if there is a fix for this. Might be.I've discussed the cons a lot (I think that is most important to get out of the way) and my comments on the AI may turn you away. But I still recommend giving this game a shot if you can get it on sale. The mechanics, despite having a logic of their own, all work together very well and make the game tense and exciting. It's fun as hell to scout a location, lay out traps, plan your encounter out, and see how it goes.

												I liked V2, but there were definitely some problems with the gameplay. Elite 3 takes the problems of 2 and improves in virtually everyway. content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												The plot of this game is that there are Nazis within range of your high-powered rifle. There's probably more to it than that, but I wasn't paying attention. Whether I don't remember anything about the story because I played this game half drunk on a lazy Saturday or because the story was just that boring and/or superfluous, I don't know. I suspect it's a combination of the two. What I do know is that the day I need a reason to shoot video game Nazis in the face is the day I renounce my American citizenship and put down my controller. I do note that the story being set in Africa was a nice change of pace from the rather more common setting of "3/4-exploded European city."But, obviously, I enjoyed this game or I wouldn't have recommended it, and I'm recommending it for the gameplay. I'm not really a connoisseur of shooters, but I thought it worked well. For the most part, the maps are pretty open, and you're given substantial leeway as to how you're going to get your mission done. Generally speaking, I appreciated this, though it did lead to a couple rather absurd situations wherein I murdered every Nazi in the postal code before accidentally stumbling upon a checkpoint and being informed that I need to make my way through an extra-special dangerous area to accomplish a plot point. Then, the game plays really intense music and the protagonist (who has a voice like disinterested, chain-smoking batman) growls about being sneaky while I take a leisurely stroll to my objective among the recently deceased sons of the Third Reich.In addition to the maps being fairly open ended, so is the Nazi murder. Your rifle is of course your work-horse, but you're also given plenty of support weapons: pistols, machine guns, land mines, trip mines, grenades, and rocket launchers. So, while the game emphasizes shooting Nazis from far away, you are more than welcome to shoot them from up close and/or explode them. Relatedly, it doesn't seem like the game knows that it's giving you all this freedom. It gives you great number of tools, tactics, tutorials and terrain with an eye toward killing all sneaky-like, but most missions can be beat quite easily by finding a high point with a good view and decent cover and then just going nuts. You see, if anyone gets close to you, they can often deal a lot of damage very fast, but threats with a range comparable to your own are few (tanks or enemies with their own rifles or rocket launchers) and fairly far-between. The rest of them are left spraying wildly with pistols or sub-machine guns, gradually moving forward into closer cover or--more often--your bullets. This is about as effective as you would imagine, and a couple dozen Nazis will be doing well to do one bandage-worth of damage to you before they're all dead or rolling around on the ground doubtlessly wondering why no one thought to give even one of them a gun that could reliably hit a target more than 30 yards away.In sum: this game has its fair share of quirks and shortcomings, but I thought the mechanic were reasonably well-executed, and using them to shoot Nazis was fun enough to earn the game a recommendation from me.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												The plot of this game is that there are Nazis within range of your high-powered rifle. There's probably more to it than that, but I wasn't paying attention. Whether I don't remember anything about the story because I played this game half drunk on a lazy Saturday or because the story was just that boring and/or superfluous, I don't know. I suspect it's a combination of the two. What I do know is that the day I need a reason to shoot video game Nazis in the face is the day I renounce my American citizenship and put down my controller. I do note that the story being set in Africa was a nice change of pace from the rather more common setting of "3/4-exploded European city."But, obviously, I enjoyed this game or I wouldn't have recommended it, and I'm recommending it for the gameplay. I'm not really a connoisseur of shooters, but I thought it worked well. For the most part, the maps are pretty open, and you're given substantial leeway as to how you're going to get your mission done. Generally speaking, I appreciated this, though it did lead to a couple rather absurd situations wherein I murdered every Nazi in the postal code before accidentally stumbling upon a checkpoint and being informed that I need to make my way through an extra-special dangerous area to accomplish a plot point. Then, the game plays really intense music and the protagonist (who has a voice like disinterested, chain-smoking batman) growls about being sneaky while I take a leisurely stroll to my objective among the recently deceased sons of the Third Reich.In addition to the maps being fairly open ended, so is the Nazi murder. Your rifle is of course your work-horse, but you're also given plenty of support weapons: pistols, machine guns, land mines, trip mines, grenades, and rocket launchers. So, while the game emphasizes shooting Nazis from far away, you are more than welcome to shoot them from up close and/or explode them. Relatedly, it doesn't seem like the game knows that it's giving you all this freedom. It gives you great number of tools, tactics, tutorials and terrain with an eye toward killing all sneaky-like, but most missions can be beat quite easily by finding a high point with a good view and decent cover and then just going nuts. You see, if anyone gets close to you, they can often deal a lot of damage very fast, but threats with a range comparable to your own are few (tanks or enemies with their own rifles or rocket launchers) and fairly far-between. The rest of them are left spraying wildly with pistols or sub-machine guns, gradually moving forward into closer cover or--more often--your bullets. This is about as effective as you would imagine, and a couple dozen Nazis will be doing well to do one bandage-worth of damage to you before they're all dead or rolling around on the ground doubtlessly wondering why no one thought to give even one of them a gun that could reliably hit a target more than 30 yards away.In sum: this game has its fair share of quirks and shortcomings, but I thought the mechanic were reasonably well-executed, and using them to shoot Nazis was fun enough to earn the game a recommendation from me.

content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
												I had never played a Sniper Elite game before so I had begun playing this game without knowing what to expect. Besides a barrage of sniping. The graphics in this game exceeds my expectation, the game truly delivers outstanding textures and effects that make the whole gaming experience more pleasureable and more enjoyable. I really enjoyed the bullet cam feature. It delivers a satisfying vibe along with every kill you perform. Though quite repetitive. Luckily, there is an option to lower the occurrences or even disable the feature. The missions are also quite repetitive. You'll find yourself performing the same objectives over and over again. The game is also rather short. There are only eight missions in total. Though each one of them can be made up of a long duration of time if you decide to take the stealth approach. Otherwise, you can blaze through each mission rather quickly if you decide to battle without the element of surprise. Another major problem is the spawning of enemies. Enemies would randomly spawn every time you fail. The enemies also tend to "camouflage" themselces by almost "merging" each other. Making the player to acknowledge that only one enemy is present. Overall, the story was great and in-depth and was well worth my time. The game isn't entirely bad. But I wouldn't recommend it either.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												Much improved version of the previous Sniper Elite games.  With every iteration of the game they seem to make improvements.  However, the game can be a bit short if you play it on easier difficulty settings.  Ramp up the difficulty settings and attempt to play through the missions completely stealth and you'll see a much longer play through.    I LOVE LOVE LOVE that they added the full on co-op, play this with a friend and you won't be disappointed in the fun you'll have.  Using Steam to connect with friends and play co-op is a breeze! I had no disconnect issues, no lag, and no fuss with playing co-op unlike many titles where you can spend hours forwarding ports, etc.  If you are looking for some competitive play I really wouldn't recommend this title though. The regular VS multiplayer was uninspired and boring and I don't recommend it for that.  It quickly devolves into hiding behind cover and firing wildly at people when you see them; basically a big camping game.  It would have been nice for them to add some objectives to complete or some incentive to move about the map.The graphics seem to be improved from the previous games.  The game runs extremely smoothly on my computer and loads lightening quick.  I haven't had any issues with game crashing or major bugs.  One issue is sometimes "invisible" cover will block your shot if you try to fire too closely to it resulting in a shot that should have hit, but doesn't.  It isn't perfect, but I still highly recommend this game if you enjoy sniping games and co-op!

content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
												Sniper Elite- A game about shooting human testicles, cos who doesn't like that? I know I do!But in all seriousness, this is one of the best sniping games of all time. I adore the Sniper Elite series for its fantastic sniping, which feels smooth and responsive. Playing on the harder modes with no aim assistence to help you shoot and with realistic ballistics makes it all the more fun. I urge you to pick up this game, or even the older but awesome Sniper Elite V2. It's even more fun to play with your friends, provided the servers don't bug up, causing multiple crashes like it did to me...So what are you waiting for? Grab that Mosin Nagant, set up your sniping nest, and hunt some balls!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
												Sniper Elite 3 is very different if you compare it to other shooting games that were realeased in the past few years. I can only say that a select few enjoy the game due to its gameplay which by some can be considered monotonous since after each shot that is notsomehow silenced you will have to relocate by walking away 50 meters and the guards will have forgotten that you even exist. The setting is very unique since this time you are not storming the beaches of Normandy but are instead crossing through African terrain and one of the most underrated military theatres in history. there is also a unique feature where whenever you fire a shot your bullet will go into slow motion as it penetrates your target permitting you to see the carnage first-hand. If you don´t understand what I mean by this think of it as the special X-ray special moves from the new Mortal Kombat games but with bullets.Pros: Unique settingAdvanced bullet physicsSlow-motion killsVast array of weapons to choose fromKill Hitler DLCCan see your bullet destroy a man´s balls via the slow-motion kill featureCons:May be considered monotonous and boring by some peopleOnly one silenced weapon in the game, making it hard to be stealthy.Conclusion:I would only recommend it if you know what you are getting into and if you are positive that you will enjoy it. Otherwise you may have wasted your money.

												The praise for 'ballistics' is 100% false. In real life the bullet drop on a 30-06 is measured by inches at long range beyond what this game has you attempt shooting at, in this game bullet drop is measured by feet at 50 yards. Really? Seriously? Do the guys at Rebellion even know one end of a gun from another? Lack of ability to change scope zero, bullet drop worse than a bb gun, all items hidden behind expensive DLC as well as several levels, the fact that this game is made by Rebellion, there is nothing but reasons NOT to buy this game. Ever. I bought it on sale and was severely disappointed to the point of disgust, thanks to Valve for allowing refunds now you guys saved me from losing on this deal.

content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
												while I did enjoy the game i feel as though this is another lazy sequel attempting to make money off of a popular franchise. While nothing is really broken with the game nothing is really new. the majority of the guns were in v2 and the ones that are new feel like re skinned versions of the old ones. the game is gorgeous running at 80 fps on my gtx 760. This game took all of the charm of urban sniping and replaced it with a.i. that hardly poses a challenge on the lower difficulties and acctually becomes interesting on the harder ones. also the map design is often bad making you shoot a couple of shots and then run off to find another hiding spot when on several maps it hardly makes sense that the enemy could determine where the shot really came from due to acoustics from desert warfare. overall this game was a fun experience (the story is very generic and often has you fighting in far too similar combat areas) however the gameplay doesn't make up for the overly generic story and basically higher resolution re-skin of sniper elite v2. tl;dr pass on this game,because it doesnt really add anything new to the frnchise and feels like a money grab.

content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
												I've never played the previous two games, but I have played Splinter Cell and Metal Gear, therefore I will be comparing SE3 to those. I would not pay more than $10 for this somewhat lazily made game.  To me, this feels like a poor man's  Stealth game; Many things I've taken for granted in other titles are absent in SE3, such as storyline, characters, dialog, humor, a decent control scheme. The story is pretty non-existent. You are a soldier in WWII killing Nazis. Almost nothing is revealed about your character. There is no dialog whatsoever, aside from the occasional monologue given about whatever mission you are on by the main character. Who gives him his orders, who are his co-workers, does he have a family? We will never know. Even games that don't focus heavily on storyy and cinematics, like Call Of Duty and Halo give a bit of background on the setting and characters.  The controls and gameplay are extremely clunky even compared to games from 2003. I have a hard time trying to figure out where I can and cannot walk/run. One time I was trying to Shoot from a tower, only to realize my bullets were hitting the railing. Much older games from the Splinter Cell and MGS franchises had much better control schemes and felt much more fluid, especially in hand-to-hand. Not only is hand to hand horribly undeveloped, but you are forced to rely heavily on it throughout the game. Even the Sniping mechanics in older games is much more fun.    I would recommend almost any other shooter/stealth game made in the past 15 years  over this one.

												Yeah, third person with gory sniping (you get a MRI scan for everyone you snipe showing exploing skulls and spleens). Basically it's a sneak around game, be patient, be silent. The game gives the idea of Far Cry freedom, but is pretty much on rails to be honest. Flaky in 3D, although ok to play with. Have completed the first mission in three sittings (I don't play much these days), and persuaded me to drop 25 quid on the season pass, for all the DLC - Hitler / Churchill missions and some guns to improve your loadout. LIttle clumsy in play style, Lara Croft did it better, but nice little shooter that's isn't in your face, and rewards if not demands... patience and a little planning. Next sale, get it, it's good!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
												Not going to discuss DLC. If you want it, get it. The game should only be judged for what it is, and likewise with the DLC. I am also not going to comment on the multiplayer aspect, just because I haven't tried it and don't really want to. It looks like there are always a few games going strong, but overall it is not very busy.+ Game length is pretty good, and open missions bring some replayability.+ Purist sniping is rewarding and not overly complicated. Likewise, if you want aim-assist, you still feel badass+ Looks pretty good aside from zoom blurring+ AI, sniping realism, and UI assistance options are independently customizable. Although there are only three settings for each, nothing in-depth+ Stealth system is good and works fine for what it is, "but"+/- Not very realistic. Stealth, AI, and many mechanics are too video game-y. As serious as the game takes itself (super gruffy mcsniper man gotta save arfica or whoever it was), it is not a realistic stealth game, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing unless you don't like that. The sniping alone may be realistic, though. I don't know, I'm not a sniper. But it emulates it well, at least. bullet drop, wind speed, yadda yadda. actually no yadda yadda, that's it I think.- Poor weapon variety (four sniper rifles in a sniping game?)- I mentioned AI is too video game-y, but I think it is so in a bad way.SE3 is a pretty good recommendation for someone who is interested in a stealth and/or sniping game that is easy to get into and easy to enjoy. It has become a little more accessible than SE2 (and like pop music compared to the first game being like black metal), but improves on the framework a LOT. My first playthrough alone is/was almost 20 hours, but the map design is pretty well done and you should be able to replay the game a couple of times and it will still feel like a different experience, especially if you practice different play styles (run and gun, booby trapped house of horror, cat and mouse, pure stealth, etc). I think there are like 8 missions in all? 8 to 10.There is nothing fancy about the stealth. It is simple and works (mostly). No parkour, pseudo-platforming, or anything remarkable. It is sight and sound-based. You crouch, go prone, hide in grass, shadows, or behind something. Instant kill enemies from behind, shoot em with a silenced pistol, take them out with a trap, or mask your shot with environmental noise. The automatic cover system is pretty seamless and I don't think it has ever frustrated me in the least. Very well implemented. I'm kind of disappointed there is no over-cover silent kill. If a guy was leaning up against a short wall and you were behind him: nope. sorry. You can hide and scurry off, and the enemy will stay pinned down assuming you are still active in your previous location (you'll see a ghost of your character, signifying you can relocate).The AI regularly switches between omniscient and brain-dead. I think that is very, very bad, but I enjoy the game regardless, and personally it's more comical and inexcusable. An enemy will hear you running in an underground bunker beneath them...but they won't see you kill a guy right in front of them 50 meters out. They will hear you walking on a roof above them and go investigate with weapons ready... even though one of their buddies was just walking around up there before I killed him undetected. They will hear you running a couple of blocks away...but they won't hear the guy who just got shot through the helmet grunt and slump to the ground five feet to the side of them. They won't be alerted by explosive traps that go off outside of combat unless they are very close.Some of the other mechanics in the game bothered me at first, too, but I quickly got over it. Sound masking makes some sense, but that logic isn't applicable to every situation. I can certainly understand shooting undetected when a plane passes low overhead, but not when some piece of machinery grunts and your gun is clearly much louder and sounds completely different (Like a gun, you know what I mean?). The sound masking is in relation to YOUR position, and never the enemy's. So when a loud noise happens near them, they will still hear you shooting just fine. Oh, and the AI will never ever see nor hear your bullet hit anybody or anything, no matter how close it is and even if it is in their field of vision.A couple bugs, but overall the game is very stable. One problem, a HUGE problem at some points, is that loading into a game will make a noise at your location. I don't know if it spawns you slightly above the ground and it's a dropping noise, or what. But it actually "broke" my mission once when I had an objective where I could NOT be detected because yaknow I was eavesdropping on something important. I saved on a platform above the conversation, and when I loaded into it again after messing something up, I alerted them with every single attempt. Not cool.Zooming in with your rifle or binoculars will make many foreground or background areas quite blurry until you aim at them and clear them up. I thought it was intentional at first, but it really looks like annoying texture bugs to me. Unsure if there is a fix for this. Might be.I've discussed the cons a lot (I think that is most important to get out of the way) and my comments on the AI may turn you away. But I still recommend giving this game a shot if you can get it on sale. The mechanics, despite having a logic of their own, all work together very well and make the game tense and exciting. It's fun as hell to scout a location, lay out traps, plan your encounter out, and see how it goes.

												This game is poor. Sniper Elite 2 was much better, but in all honesty that isn't saying much. The following reasons are why this game is terrible and should not be purchased, or redeemed for free as I have.1. Broken movement mechanics: There is horrible mouse acceleration which cannot be adjusted and makes movement very difficutl.2. Broken Shooting mechanics. I play on Sniper Elite mode as well as realist mode. Aiming over a targets head and compensating for bullet drop was not consistant. Slightly shooting over their head then compensating by a little made me shoot the target in the lower chest or pevlis on many occasions. Bullet mechanic are broken.3. Beyond repetative. Increadable linear battlefield. Terrible AI. Increase in difficult turns up the speed of the AI aimbot.The Positive: Xray vision on shooting people is a cool and enjoyable aspect. For about 30 minutes. And Since Sniper Elite 2 has the exact same Xray, set in the European Theater, with much less buddy mechanics. That is the game you should choose if you want to just destroy people with xray bullet cams.I will try to suffer through a few hours of gameplay just to make this review more respectable.

content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
												I've just finished playing through the single player campaign on marksman difficulty, and I really enjoyed the game.  A nice balance of interesting maps, and different scenarios to consider.  It's a huge improvement over V2 which was more linear and involved far more close quarter encounters.I've started again on authentic difficulty and I'm enjoying the struggle.  The enemy AI is really good I think, although it would be nice to be able to fine tune the assistance.  For example:  I'd like to be able to range find with the binoculars, but not tag enemies.  I'd like to see my health bar, but not the tactical map.  I'd like to have free reign with the loadout and swap all my health kits for trip mines if I so desired.Also, the people complaining about not having a zillion different guns to choose from, I think are missing the point.  I played through the game with the same rifle, pistol combination and didn't feel like anything was missing.It's a great game.  And while the x-ray kill cam is awesome initially, it does get tiresome quickly, and I ended up turning it off near the end.  You can also press space during kill cam and it'll skip, which is a very nice feature.I'm looking forward to the multiplayer.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												Much improved version of the previous Sniper Elite games.  With every iteration of the game they seem to make improvements.  However, the game can be a bit short if you play it on easier difficulty settings.  Ramp up the difficulty settings and attempt to play through the missions completely stealth and you'll see a much longer play through.    I LOVE LOVE LOVE that they added the full on co-op, play this with a friend and you won't be disappointed in the fun you'll have.  Using Steam to connect with friends and play co-op is a breeze! I had no disconnect issues, no lag, and no fuss with playing co-op unlike many titles where you can spend hours forwarding ports, etc.  If you are looking for some competitive play I really wouldn't recommend this title though. The regular VS multiplayer was uninspired and boring and I don't recommend it for that.  It quickly devolves into hiding behind cover and firing wildly at people when you see them; basically a big camping game.  It would have been nice for them to add some objectives to complete or some incentive to move about the map.The graphics seem to be improved from the previous games.  The game runs extremely smoothly on my computer and loads lightening quick.  I haven't had any issues with game crashing or major bugs.  One issue is sometimes "invisible" cover will block your shot if you try to fire too closely to it resulting in a shot that should have hit, but doesn't.  It isn't perfect, but I still highly recommend this game if you enjoy sniping games and co-op!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 8, 2014
												For those of you who are saying this game isn't better than V2 and that it sucks, you're all ignorant. I hate whining people... Anyway, with that said, this game does have its problems (mainly in multiplayer). The single player is fun. Its very short, but hell, its fun and rewarding especially on higher difficulty levels. You get the freedom to do what you want in all the missions and you can use whatever tools at your disposal to complete your mission. Now in terms of content for this game, there should have been more. But what can I say? No game is absolutely perfect in its own nature. The developers put most of the "extra content" into DLC bundles if you want an upper hand. They really aren't that jaw dropping or needed for completing missions but they do help in multiplayer. Ahh, multiplayer. Multiplayer is definitely a fun and exciting expirience all around, but there is quite a bit of lag going on but idk if thats because of my connection or if its actually the server. Also, there are quite a few glitches. For instance, I could be running to a corner to get some cover and hear another person shoot, I would assume they miss me but as I get around the corner, I fall over dead. Its that kind of stuff that makes people hate it and I understand. But the Devs will fix this in no time. Also, there needs to be more people on multiplayer. Sometimes I cant even find a game. Overall, this game is fun and really enjoyable. Just stick with your gut. It is a pretty high price tag, but I am definitley glad that I bought it. The multiplayer is just too fun for me to pass up.

content:
Posted: February 14, 2015
												Awful camera and controls will end up killing you countless times when you stand in front of an enemy in perfect sight while the camera (ie you) is behind a wall blocking your sight... The camera is fixed on the right side behind the character meaning you dont have the same view as the character and this is extremly frustrating. The character movement is jerky and game physics is clearly lacking, for instance run into an object you are thrown sideways in a very unnatural way. I love sniper games but this is clearly an unfinished game or really bad PC port.An important bug to keep in mind: Quick saving isn't permanent meaning if you quit the game without doing a real save via the save menu you will lose all progress.On the plus side if you can live with the camera problems it's a fairly good game with good graphics and enjoyable kills.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 7, 2015
												Great game! Good graphics and physics. Great storyline and awesome maps. Some of the maps and missions are so well build, they give you the sense of real proportions, space and time, that's a first for a video game. It can be challenging and fun to walk around to complete the mission in a personal way and not guided by the AI. I'm not the kind of patient player, i'm head out first in the action but i really enjoyed this game and it is my favourite for PC.The only bad experience with this game is the fact that i've encountered a few cheating players on multiplayer servers, wallhaking to be more specific. Great value for money if you get it on %sale.

content:
Posted: February 23
												I cannot recommend this game, spend the first 30-60 min of my gametime just trying to figure out how to get at least 60 fps. Was stuck on 20-30 fps on low setting with a gtx 960 card, after trying diffrent of suggestions from forums i finally got my fps to around 90-120 on ultra settings. finally i could actually play the game, that was at least what i thought. Then the game started to crash every 20-30 min. Tried to look up another fix for this but this time the suggestions did not help me. Not only the really bad crash and fps problems this game has, the gameplay seems extremly boring. There is little to none actuall sniping in this game, once in a while you find a generator that can mask your shot (so the enemies wont hear you) but this is the only time you can actually snipe. the rest of the time you have to try and get into close combat to either shoot them with your silenced pistol or give them a knife in the back. i only reached to third mission until i simply gave up on this game. Sorry for my bad english

content:

												3/10 Literally unplayable!If you ALT+TAB you never get back in the game as the moment you click resume it takes you back to the desktop where you have to killtask it and start it again.It glitches in the campain as when you aim the sniper rifle, zoom in and hold breath the red aim thingy is well below the crosshair making it impossible to accurately shoot anything. It crashes so many times without the faintest error message just the annoying "Sniper Elite stopped working".Updated graphics driver, set game details to medium, altough my machine can run the game at 200fps on ultra, updated game files and now i get the Run time error Microsoft C++.It's a great game overall and love the play-style of sneaking and sniping badies but the errors and alt+tab thing and the persistent glitches ruin it.

I'm dying to see what's up that hill, around that corner or behind that rock. I'd certainly be willing to pay for the experience. Come on, just expand the maps!

												I really enjoyed this game for the first few hours.- nice graphics- amazing and very satisfying killcams- good soundThen the clunky controls and all those weapons and Items I never used, started to annoy me.After like 4 hours, I got tired of killcams and the lame story, so I started skipping everything.What was left was... nothing really. I suddenly got no reason to keep on playing. Just played till the end expecting to get better. But It didn't get better, I finished one level and didn't realize it was the last one. It just ended. Short game.I'm glad I got this on sale, but I would not recommend this, even on sale. It's gonna stay on my steam library forever reminding me of a failed purchase.Don't bother, better use this moneh for Tacos, or a date, beers,... whatever.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												So you are interested in this Game and want to know if its good ?If you ask me, i can say to you ; It is a good Game if you like Stealth-Action Third Person Shooters and WW2 Setting - First let me tell to you what games you may can compare to this,- Splinter Cell- Hidden and Dangerous- Commandos 3- Metal Gear Solid- Hitman 1 & 2So if you liked the games listed above then i think you also will like Sniper Elite 3 - and if you liked Sniper Elite 1&2 then let me tell you this game is a little bit better then theese areWhat i like ?- Nice GraphicOk the Graphic wont be the best you have seen - but it is good enough to play the game and it feels kind of realistic .The Night mission looks fantastic with a great atmosphere and the special effects are also good.- Stealth Gameplay This is one kind of the games where you really need to act stealthy, you cannot simply run and shoot trough the missions like call of duty! NO ! if you play on Sniper Elite difficult it really makes fun to stealth and it is really the only way to finish the mission - alive^^- Bullet CamWhat can i say ? The X.Ray Cam is so much fun and makes me fear of myself when i see my bullets hits balls,lungs ,brains and bones and make them broken or explode - really , i fear that^^- Big LevelsThe levels are really big and you can spend 1 or 2 hours with stealth progress till you have accomplish all mission objectives - there are also some side-missions like taking out spotting lights or trucks - wich is really cool- Level System and ExperienceYou gain EXP and Level Up , and the best is, you can level up in multiplayer AND singleplayer with the same character and it feels good that everything you make or kill is importent - because it gives you exp and you will rank up again and again -you can also find weopon parts in singleplayer campaign and then can modify your weapons for singleplayer and multiplayer with it - isnt that cool ?So - there are also a good Storyline, but it is not cinematic or hollywood like - it is more like a 08/15 story but it is okay -the gameplay itself makes the game fantastic !- You can take bodies and bring them to another point so that enemys will not see them and make alarm - like in splinter cell or hitman - i really like that ! its more realistic and stealth is fun ;DSo what can be better ?----------------------------- More weapons would be fine because you have only 4 Sniper Rifles to choose as i can see right now and only 4 MP Guns - that is not really much - and there are the same weapon mods for all 4 rifles - and theese are not that different anyway. So that could be more and better ;-(- Controls with Mous and Keyboard feels a bit slow and difficult,you will often keep hanging at rocks and barrels and something like this,also it does not feels very realistic how the character moves - this could be better !!!With a xbox one or 360 controller it makes a lot fun to play - but i dont recommend you to play with controller in multiplayer because aiming is no that fast as it would be with mouse^^- Some smaller bugs but no game breaking- Coop Multiplayer only is avaible with steam friends right now - but in the official manual they say we can play coop with friends OR wih online players - but there is no option at the moment to play with online players - so i dont know if it is a bug or if the manual tell us a lie ;D we will see if they will fix it because none of my friends have this game and so o cannot play coop - that really sucks ! I WANT COOP WITH ONLINE PLAYERS ! NOW ;DSo,at the end - it is a good game with nice atmosphere about a single elite sniper in special missions at the time of world war 2 in Africa - better then Sniper Elite 2 in some ways but no big jump or next gen game - but it makes fun if you like stealth games and coop-games ( hopefully with online players soon) with friends who also have this game-There are many achievements you can complete and some collectibles in singleplayer campaign-also there are some survival modes for single and coop and nice multiplayer game modes like a mode where the winner is the one with the longest distance kill - which is perfect mode for sniping ;DSo if you are interested in this game ! You can buy it , it makes fun - it is no broken or silly game like othersYou will have alot things to do and if you feel boring in campaign you can always play multiplayer or coop- level up TO BE THE BEST SNIPER ELITE EVER thx for readingMoon

content:
Posted: October 4, 2015
												I've played a lot of, and beaten many times, Sniper Elite v2 on my Xbox 360. That was an excelent game, 10/10. However, this installment in the series is just garbage.Firstly, the amount of glitches and bugs present is ridiculous. For a polished game, especially after the non-glitched Sniper Elite v2, there are too many bugs (and very serious ones too) and don't seem like they are ever going to be fixed by the devs. Ex: I was mid-bullet cam (a quarter of the way through my first mission) and my game crashed, I had to quit it and restart the game. Another serious bug is when I beat the first mission only to proceed to the main menu and it saying that I haven't beat the first mission and I must restart it.Aside from the bugs and glitches, it is basically like Sniper Elite v2 but in a different environment, oh and I should mention that the environment is WAY TOO BRIGHT. Even if you turn down the gamma, the reflection of the world and brightness of the terrain is blinding, that is not realistic and extremely annoying after a while.There are, essentially, the same amount of guns, slightly more equipment; and the sound effects of weapons, germans, and the environment, are exactly the same. You can "customize" your rifle...but changing the reticle and material of the scope is not full customization.Also, long range sniping (like the second game) is barely present. The game is mostly close-quarters so you don't have much breathing room to stop and make a shot at a far distanced enemy. Snipers are meant to fire from long distances, not 5 feet away from the enemy.On the pleasent side, the multiplayer experience is fun, and the survival mode is alright. The bullet cam hasn't changed too much but it is still exciting to watch a bullet rip through a German soldier's nutsack. There is bountiful amount of enemies in a mission so you can just keep picking off those damn Nazi soldiers until you have had your killing fix. I can't think of any more good qualities of the game.So with everything (or what I can think of) said, I unfortunatelly cannot recommend Sniper Elite 3. I paid $21 on sale (for the game+season pass) which I regret. I'm trying to save you from spending your money on this let-down failure of a game. You can watch videos and read other reviews and I gaurentee you that most of them are negative towards this game.Rating? 5/10Note: My edits (or updates) were just grammar corrections.

content:
Posted: October 8, 2016
Product received for free
												<Review after gaining access via "free weekend">The shooting is awesome, the stealth is good. So why the downvote?A simple, yet extremely annoying bug. Given the game isn't new, how this bug still exists in the game is a mystery.What bug is this? Well - you line up a shot, you fire... nothing happens. The enemy is still alive. You think "well, OK, perhaps I twitched at the last moment and missed?". You line up a second shot, fire... another miss. What gives? Well, you're shooting the small wall / barrier / plank in front if you rather than the target. The scope suggests you're well above it, but nope, you're not shooting where you think you are. The "hold breath" also shows the bullet should hit the target (not obstructed).This bug appeared so many times during my relatively short game, than I really don't wish to bother with it any more. Which is a damn shame, because the game otherwise seems great.EDIT:I think it might boil down to something similar to this:


YouTube™ Video: ➜ A Quick Look @ Sniper Elite 3 | GeForce GTX 950  | 60 FPS | 1080p 

			Views: 29		

			This game is available from Steam here: http://store.steampowered.com/app/238090 A quick look @ 'Sniper Elite III' My Thoughts: There's not a Sniper Elite game I haven't liked yet, even the Zombie...		

I.e. perhaps parts of the scenery which don't obstruct the view are programmed as solid objects, and stop bullets?

content:
Posted: September 14, 2014
												This is my first time playing a sniper elite game. So I apologise if I get anything wrong. I feel like this game is not very story based. Yes, there are a few cutscenes but thats about it. I feel as if the story is not gripping enough to grab my attention. The missions drag on for ages, and I sometimes lose track of what I'm doing or why I'm doing this mission. Every mission feels the same to me. I have to go and destroy/kill someone or something and kill multiple enimies along the way. The map is nice and big, but the game feels linear. It's like invisible barriers all over the map and I can't climb on certain things and go to certain areas. Overall, I think this game needs a bit more story depth, sand-box approach and more creative missions. If the devs do that then this game would easily be worth the money, but for now it is not and I would not recommend this game

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												I'm just glad I got this game for FREE with my AMD gold reward.The overall game design sucks, shows the developers aren't up to the task. It all starts with the kinky cutscenes that could have been done in year 2000. The intro is that bad and uninteresting, you just have to skip the trash.Animations suck, level design is a joke, sound isn't statisfying at all, story...what story?, character movement feels wrong, A.I sucks (they're just cannon fodder), the HUD and all the messages in it to guide the player through even the easiest situations are so annoying - it plays like some arcade shooter such as CoD but in third person and much worse than CoD. In fact, any CoD is the better choice.The graphics are so extremely unspectacular, everything looks way too bloomy and clean. Character faces show no emotion, they rather remind me of games such as Gothic3. Level graphics show, that everything has been just thrown together in the maps. Nothing seems to be really handcrafted, just dropped randomly on the terrain from a larger "pre-fabs" library.The game is called Sniper Elite but the Sniper Elite titles were never really focussed on real life sniping, instead it's some simplistic long range arcade mass shooter, the sniping is more like camping. Going rambo is much more effective and solves the game much faster however. lolA Sniper game should give you the impression that you are alone and surrounded by danger. That you HAVE to land every shot and maybe sometimes take your time by just sitting in one place, as stealthy as possible, for a while to accomplish this.In this game however, you run around like a chicken with your rifle, pistol, machine gun and shoot stuff from different spots all the time. Like some uber soldier from another planet.

content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
												Well now that I have finished the 3rd installment of Sniper Elite, I am a fan of the franchaise. Well I was a fan after the first one anyway.So how do I begin to review this game.Let me start by saying that the gamemakers finally got most of this game on the correct track. After playing the first two, this one sort of forces you to play more as a sniper or face enemies coming down one you if you are spotted. There is also an XP ranking system within the game, so quiet sniped killes give you more XP than making the shot and alerting other soldiers. You have the cover of noise to help you AND enemies can now start to detect you. Just like in FarCry 3. If you have played that game,you will know what I am talking about. And if you are detected, you have to relocated. You don't have to, but it does help. You can also tag enemies with your binoculars, one by one. This does help in the game as well.A notable feature added to this game is the stealth kill. You sneak up from behind and make a silent kill with your knife. Again, like the takedown in FarCry 3. AND, the WELROD is your FRIEND!!!! Use it wisely.There are 8 missions all together, and within those missions, you have objectives and optional objectives to do. You will do wise to do all the optional objectives as well. But unlike in SE2, the missions take longer! I myself was taking about 1-2 hours per mission. I was even viewing Youtube to locate items for the game and it helped greatly. And the missions are not always easy. So you get a lot of gameplay on this one. I did this one in 30 hours. I did SE2 in 11 hours. So hence the difference.It's pretty much the same routine gameplay as well. But in the desert now. It was a nice change.Now for a couple of negatives....The graphics can be heavy. I was on lowest settigs and the first mission, the gameplay was choppy, it got better when you got out of the main battle and into the mountains. But could be my system, but just a heads up. The choppiness went away after awhile on the other maps. I only ran into very few instances where it slowed down.The ohter thing and this is NOT my system, I can guarantee you that. The players movements.It seems to be a half and half of the first two games. The first one having horrible movement, like if you were to just tap your direction key, you'd move a lot. This made it difficult to get angles to snipe at. SE2, the movement was a lot better, You could stop pretty fast from running and was able to make angle shots easier. NOW it seems that in this one, OK you can stop pretty easy, but if you are running and get caught on a corner or obatacle, you get stuck for a brief moment, just like in the first one. It's rather annoying that they did this and again, making tight angle shots and all you want to do is inch over... forget it... It's hard.But if you can overcome those small nuances, then you will have a really enjoyable experience with this game. Oh ya, the bullet cam... It's great still, but they made the bullet look too big now. It's unrealistic. It looks like dumb actually and at least with the bullet size in SE2, It was more realistic and believable.The only ONE other thing that was annoying actually was ending the missions. Ok cool, you had to maybe provide cover for an escapee or create a distraction. But a few missions required that you take out tanks. Kind of opposite of stealth here. Maybe it's me, but you do the whole mission perfect and in the end, you have to Rambo you way out sometimes. Not exactly the most ideal of things.Happy sniping!

												Simply, this is not a snipping game anymore!!! You rarely have to use your sniper, and the game does not reward you at all for snipping!!! You are encouraged to sneak, do stealth kills, and use your silenced pistole!!!If you fire sniper once, you have to retreat couple of meters until bar empties. and if you fire your sniper 2 times, then hae to retreat a bit more to make enemies go to their postions again!!! And the game keeps going like this to the end!!AI is so dumb, it does not matter what diffic setting you choose, each enemy moves in the same dirction back and forth!!!Most of the time you have to walk ducked down, becz the character will run without you using key or button, and enemies will hear you.No bosses fights, and no challenging events. It is purely a cheap stealth game that does not encourage anything new or tries to push you to think!!!Still worth playing for 10$ but not for a full price or even half-price

Posted: January 5, 2016
												If you loved Sniper Elite 2, steer clear of this game. If you enjoy 'dramatic' set pieces and are 11 years old, buy Sniper Elite 3.I played through the first 2 missions on 'authentic' or whatever they called the realistic setting. First mission is a big set piece where you take out a tank that literally cannot kill you, even if you're standing in the open. The rest of the enemies were positioned in single file facing all in the same direction, so you can kill them from behind with ease. Even when they did happen to notice me, they shook their heads frantically and screamed, giving me plenty of time to shoot them 4 times in the chest, reload and finally kill them. A disappointing game.

content:
Posted: August 3, 2014
												whenever I wasn't setting up a shot, emptying my lungs, and pumping a sharp metal bullet through the thick skull of an unsuspecting enemy soldier, I was frustrated with Sniper Elite III. Not because the surrounding mechanics are broken or the levels are poorly structured, as the subsidiary elements of this third-person shooter are, for the most part, serviceable. However, every action building up to you actually pulling the trigger of a rifle feels more like a chore than an interesting setup for the perfect shot. There's an undeniable satisfaction that stems from the glorious slow-motion kills that abound in Sniper Elite III, but missions tend to promote stealthy, silent takedowns rather than the grotesque headshots it does so well.Fortunately, what the game does best is on full display early on. The level design in Sniper Elite III is more open than previous games in the series, often encouraging shots being fired from more than 300 meters away. Instead of funneling you down a straight path, each of the eight locations in the campaign presents you with a sniping sandbox where creativity leads to better shooting and stronger positioning. Bullishly rushing headfirst into enemy territory is always an option, but the grizzled protagonist crumples to the dirt after just a pair of well-placed shots. Silent steps often lead to better vantage points, and with so many routes to choose from in any given level, the method by which the objective is completed is up to you.That doesn't make this an open-world game, though. There are various side objectives like shutting down search lights or sabotaging the enemy's explosives supply, but there's still a clear path to completion within every mission. An ever-present objective marker reminds you that just 200 meters away lies a folder of intel that could greatly benefit the Allied forces, and all you need to do to collect it is pick off whatever patrolling soldiers stand in the way.You're not required to kill everything with a heartbeat in order to progress, but the innate satisfaction that comes with long-range marksmanship is almost too great to pass up. After perching atop a sniper nest and locating a viable target, you have the option of steadying your breath and adding an additional red reticle that illustrates exactly where your bullet will drop. Once you fire off that perfect shot, the camera ignores the man behind the rifle and instead follows the round as it leisurely approaches its mark. It's a remarkable scene that all but erases auxiliary threats, letting you enjoy the slow-motion mayhem. The crack of your barrel will likely alert anything with a heartbeat nearby, but in that very moment, all that matters is the journey of a single bullet.

content:
Posted: March 10
												Short honest answer here is that the gameplay is amazing, fun, smart, somewhat new, and it is just good time. However, this game CTD extremely frequently so much so it is unplayable. Luckily there is a fix for this, but you have to roll back your Nvidia Driver Version to at least version 376.33. If you are experiencing frequent CTDs then that is the likely problem you are having. So check your Nvidia Driver Version.-Quote From Rebellion-"Nvidia has confirmed there is an issue with their more recent drivers that may be behind crashes some players have been reporting recently.They are working on a fix and we will try to keep you updated with any developments. For anyone with an Nvidia card experiencing crashes, for now please try rolling back your drivers to at least 376.33. Obviously this is not ideal, and is not intended as a permanent solution."The roll back was indeed the fix I need to get this game running properly. No more CTDs:) However, I still can't recommend this game. While it is really fun, it is plagued by this CTD problem. Even though there is a fix for it... it is not a great one, and I can't recommend you buy this game at the moment. If they do fix this issue without you having to roll back the I do suggest you buy this game if you are on the fence about it. Hopefully, I will remember to edit this review if they do fix this issue.

												Oh beleive me if you are one of those people who wants just a little bit of complexity in a game? YOU GOT IT. If you want a challenge you found it. Even me (Im a bit of an elite in stealth mechanics) had trouble handling this game at times. It requires alot of forethought and that is what makes this game very enjoyable!Oh and try to get a freind with you as well. Nothing is more satisfying than blowing 2 guys away quietly with 2 guns on them!

content:
Posted: July 5, 2016
Rating2/10Yes, I have only played two hours, but that is because I am hoping to get a refund. If it is denied, then I will finish this game. Sniper Elite III is in the top five worst games I have ever played. Infact, I went and bought Sniper Elite V2 first because I wanted to play this but I didn't want to ruin the experience of the older game. Turns out that V2 was MUCH, MUCH better than this, even with its near lack of any stealth and stupid AI.The level design is the worst aspect of the game. It just feels really cramped and linear, even more so than V2. What I finished of the story was really quite boring. Rebellion did well in most the stealth aspects (despite the dumb AI that forgets that they just saw their friend be brutally gunned down in front of them after a few minutes) but it felt really... forced. The game is far too difficult to complete unless you use stealth, and the only glaring problem with it that most of your time will be spent getting to the position to welrod people in the head or stab them in the neck. The sound masking is not extensive enough, so most of the time you won't even have a chance to use your sniper rifle, despite the game being called 'Sniper Elite'.The AI are improved over V2, but I would think that in fricking 2014 they would have the capability to make them smart enough to not be: Blind, Deaf, and forgetful as hell to the point where they can't seem to recall after a few minutes that there are dead bodies lying all around the place because a sniper has been shooting people up, and that they need to find this sniper and kill him.I would recommend in place of this Dishonoured, Hitman or Metal Gear Solid five. Even though I was not impressed by V2 or III, I am interested in the upcoming Sniper Elite IV in Feburary 2017, since from what I have read many of these problems have been rectified.

Posted: February 7, 2015
												Overall its an ok game, not worth the the price they are charging.  Wait for a sale.  Ballistics are a little wacky for the ranges you are shooting, for me I kept on getting frustrated with the amount of bullet drop over rather short "sniping" distances, under 150 meters, which doesn't require a sniper, and also the auto weapons bullet spread after very short burst and the amount of time it takes for it to return to center mass.  15 dollars is what I spent and i got my moneys worth out of it.  Haven't played all the way through and maybe i'll be pleasantly surprised if I manage to make myself complet it and if so will change my recommendation, but still....not for full price....like...half at least. Especially with lovely DLC's that make the game sooooo much more enjoyable right :D....*sigh*

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 18, 2015
												Ok first of all I have to mention that I spent nearly 30 hours in previous titles 10 hours in first sniper elite a very good, now quite an archaic game in terms of graphics, but still playable and 20 or more hours in sniper elite v2 and I can honestly tell you that sniper elite 3 isn't as good as the previous games, I will try to tell you why in these few senteces. Sniper Elite 3 has little to no innovations, sure there are stealth kills from behind and you can customize your loadout before the mission and the missions are wide open and they can be completed different ways but thats about it. Those are the only new things sniper elite 3 developers brought us. The game suffers from a lot of bugs like pin point accurate enemies with machine guns and extremely accurate enemy snipers, the annoyingly quick tanks and armour and lots of weird bugs in terms of enemy detection and so on. The graphics seem a bit better compared to previous sniper elite v2, but not by much. it all feels like it was done way too quick for my taste, campaign isn't as lenghty as in sniper elite v2, you only have 8 campaign missions and thats it, some of them are extremely linear, like the last two missions, which are quite difficult too and overall the game just feels rushed, the hunt for the grey wolf mission dlc isn't as good as I expected to be, but at least the three lovely maps about protecting churchill were worth it. Overall I would give this game a fair 7/10 and I would reccomend this game to fans of the genre

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
												How do I even review this masterpiece!? Best sniper game on the market for sure and the Kill Hitler DLC is simply...The best...DLC...EVER! Kill Hitler, change history, if only this guy was real. Ha. Well let's get on shall we? I had really high expectations regarding this game and they broke every single one of them, whatever went wrong in Sniper Elite v2 like the AI for example has been fixed in SE3. I also like how Stealth is even more important here as it was on SEV2, if you decide to go Rambo, don't. Seriously, just don't. You're gonna get ganked and if you're not fast enough, you're dead. I like the Close Quarters takedowns you can pull off and the revamped kill cam is just hilarious to see sometimes, I did notice some bugs where for example the bullet came out of my barrel in reverse, directed at me, but ended up showing where I hit my target, doesn't happen too often but I think this is something Rebellion should look into. The best thing about this game are the realistic mechanics a real life sniper would come in contact with, you can't just point your crosshair at someone's head and expect a instant headshot on him, you really have to take the distance of the shot and the wind in consideration and adjust your aim accordingly. Great game, if you're into sniping, buy this..Immidiately. For me personally, it is the best game I bought this year.

number of helpful: 4 of 11 people (36%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 8, 2016
Product received for free
												It's called Sniper Elite but you spend most of your time sneaking around and frankly if I wanted to play a stealth game Hitman and Metal Gear Solid would do a way better job.  For starters the AI is dumb as rocks and you'll need to fire multiple times for the enemy to send anyone to check your location, and even then you'll largely have the time to run to another spot.Well, if you can find a spot that is, because levels are really limited with invisible walls everywhere. Of course you could always go for stealth melee kills (of course it has that) but with the AI it's almost cheating.  Last options would be your MP and pistol but somehow people just fall down and get up like nothing happened when shot once, so you really have to go for headshots. Note that a shot to the head to someone wearing a helmet doesn't make any noise, so as long as nobody directly witness the death you'll be fine.At least the game is short and doesn't have too many weapons or diverging paths so replayability is low.  There's also very little in term of story, not that it's any good either.Nothing to see here, move along.

content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
												If you like first person shooters, where you need to try and be silent but deadly, this is a game for you. It has amazing graphics and amazing story line, there arn't many glitches which i like.EDIT: ive gotten more hours into the game and ive meat some friends that play it so i know alot more about it. First sniper elite 3 has coop campaign which is only for two player.. obviously. nothing changes in the campaign but thats okay its still fun to do with someone. there is also overwatch, survival and solo survival. Overwatch is where you have to scout ahead and complete certain objectives while the other person (sniper) watches your back. Survival is where you have to survive 15 waves.. each 3 waves of my expirience on beachhead there is an armored truck and you need to take that down. there are still ammo boxes and relocations needed but you dont have to be quiet. Solo survival is the exact same thing as survival... just by yourself. You can also play Deathmatch team deathmatch capture teh flagand more with maps... and you ccan play with more than 1 person... obviously again. There are no quickscoping and yelling sqeakers... you may have them every once in a while but in my opinion parents should not have 7 and under play this game... alot of testical shots and slow movement... GO BACK TO CODDo i rate this game up? Yes.

Posted: October 10, 2016
Product received for free
												 Game is way too glitchy and sometimes unresponsive, that's already bad but you can still enjoy the game if you mind and ignore some bugs here and there. You can't fully customize the movement keys (like an option to allow walk toggle instead of forcing you to hold Left Alt everytime you don't want to walk like a hunchback) and that makes movement clunky at times and literally the thing that is going to get you killed sometimes and for a stealth game like this it is just unnaceptable. You can still bite the bullet with an X-Ray but for me it is not worth it, also the DLC is way overpriced even if only for MP stuff, cosmetic skins and some weapons

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Sniper Elite 3 made good improvments over SE v2  it has better loadout edit wider maps and enemys dont know exactly where you are after one shot so you can relocate and go ahead.The gfx are also improved and the whole game seems like a solid Port, also the xrays are even more fun in the new game and they never get old its always a pleasure to watch them.The PC Version also has Dedicated Servers thats always a plus because matchmaking sucks.The Main Game took me 8 Hours on Normal Difficult but i will do it again on the Hardest.All in all i had a blast with this game for me it was a nice mixture of Arcade/Strategy/Stelth combat that never felt to realistic or to CoD like.I would give it 1 8/10
